Reviews.Title: “What's Not To Like”
Reviews.Author: no818528
Reviews.Content: Just spent 2 nights at the Hotel Icaria and cannot express enough what a top class hotel this is. From the moment of my arrival, I felt that the entire staff went above and beyond to ensure that I enjoyed my stay. The hotel is spotlessly clean, and has everything you could ask for. The rooms are more than adequate, and the breakfast is superb. In addition, they offer very competitive rates. If there is one drawback, it may be the location, as it is not centrally located. However, it is so easy to get in and out of the city centre, this should not have any bearing on your decision. A great hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Modern, clean hotel with helpful staff”
Reviews.Author: Chozz
Reviews.Content: We spent a weekend at this hotel with a group of lads. We arrived early from our flight, but the staff did their best to check us in early. In the end, we were eager to investigate the city, so left them bags in storage. The rooms were neat, tidy and compact. I had requested a quiet room, and was given an end of corridor location on a high floor which was great. Staff were all very professional and very helpful with information about the area, all spoke great english. The location is decent, within a 5/10 minute walk of the port area, which has plenty of good bars and restaurants. From there its a slightly longer walk into the city centre, but still is a nice area along the beach. The only slight concerns I had with the hotel was the expensive breakfast at €12pp - there is a great bakery within 2 minutes walking distance which was much more reasonable. But overall I would definitely recommend this place for all types of vistiors.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, great location”
Reviews.Author: AnnTune
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for my birthday in 2011 and had a great time. Close to Icaria beach and Olympic port for super restaurants. Relaxing pool and breakfast a little busy but still would go back. Tried for my birthday this year but fully booked. Staff, bar and restaurant very good.

Reviews.Title: “Very recommendable, especially for families”
Reviews.Author: FrankfurtDennis
Reviews.Content: Quite good value. We liked the location close to the beach and not to far from the center of the city.

Reviews.Title: “Our Stay - March 2012”
Reviews.Author: SDSPhotographycouk
Reviews.Content: Myself and my girlfriend recently stayed at Hotel Icaria (March 25th-30th 2012) Our flight arrived in Barcelona at 9:30pm which meant it was dark, so we opted for a taxi to the hotel as we didn't fancy any hastle. The taxi cost 28euros which included all fayres/additional charges. We managed to return to the airport on our way home using public transport (very easily) as we had more idea of where we were going and it cost 50% less than getting a taxi. We were pleasantly greeted by the staff who were friendly and very helpful throughout our stay. Again, as it was late and we didn't know the area, we decided to get some room service - pizza & sangria (a must) which was lovely. ACCOMMODATION: The hotel is brilliant, really modern and well looked after in every way. Lovely bathroom with all the amenities you need including: free wifi (hit of miss, but still works fine) air con (we had problems with this, however as soon as we informed the staff they fixed this from the reception desk) tv (with a couple of english channels - channel 4 and some news stations) ice machines on every floor. & a mini bar LOCATION : The hotel is situated along the newly refurbished costal area, which may not be slap bang in the middle of 'La Rambla' however if you want to get into the city centre you have 2 great options a) By Foot - Take a 30-40 minute walk along the beach into the city centre. We did this most days as we are more than happy to walk places b) Metro - the metro station we used was 'ciutadella vila olimpica' this station is a 10 minute walk away from the hotel and takes you into the city centre in a matter of minutes Also, if you choose to get an open top bus tour, there is a pick up / drop off stop within 1 minutes walk of the hotel TIPS: - Cheap food/booze - if you go to la rambla (which is a place we found ourselves visiting every day) you must go to a supermarket called 'Carrefour express' where you can buy 6 small bottles of cider for 1.30euros and wine from as little as 0.93euros! (it depends how fussy you are as to what you think of it, but we really liked the wine, even more so as it was so cheap!!) ** we found ourselves eating out for lunch around 3/4pm then taking some food to the hotel with us from this supermarket to eat for tea e.g baguettes, salami, olives, crisps and salad - all for very cheap!! ** - Eating Tapas & Paelle on La Rambla - This was one of the top 10 things we were told to avoid by our 'top 10 Barcelona' book however you can get plenty of good deals. One thing you need to confirm before sitting down is that you can choose your tapas dishes as we were given random dishes on our first experience. We were more sure of ourselves the second time around and got exactly what we wanted. Its a brilliant experience sitting in the sun, eating gorgeous food, drinking sangria with your partner and enjoying the views and sounds. definitely do it! - Shopping / BARTER, BARTER, BARTER!! - if you want to get souvenirs, DO NOT BUY ANYTHING FROM THE MAIN STRIP ON THE LA RAMBLA! across the road (either side of the strip) there are plenty of souvenir shops where the shop keepers will offer you discounts to literally anything inside their shop if you pick an item up. most items we managed to get for around 40% off the labeled price. It makes a massive difference to your trip :) KEEP AN EYE ON YOUR POSSESSIONS - we read loads of articles of advice stating how dangerous Barcelona as an area was for people getting their items stolen. I don't think it is any different to any other capital city i've ever visited, you just have to be vigilant and careful/sensible with your items. Don't panic! I hope this review comes in useful to your trip. It's a beautiful city. You can view mine and my partners photographs from our trip here: http://sdsphotography.co.uk/barcelona-2012/

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: Simonandkaren6569
Reviews.Content: Very clean, nice rooms, lovely breakfast lots of choice. Leisure facilities bit limited, jacuzzi did not work and there are no changing rooms. Good location for Port Olympic, 20min walk on sea front into town. Beware there are pickpockets at port Olympic not just on la ramble so be careful.....

Reviews.Title: “Chaotic front desk, small hot rooms: not so great”
Reviews.Author: Opera-loverOxford
Reviews.Content: There's nothing very special about this hotel. It's quite a walk into the city centre and it's not near a Metro station. The breakfast buffet looks tempting, but the hot dishes are strangely cold. The coffee comes from a self-service machine. The rooms are small, and their air conditioning system doesn't work very well. The wifi is slow. And the front desk is simply chaotic. Checking out was taking forever and I had a plane to catch: three staff were on duty but seemed unable to process other guests in less than 20 minutes each. So finally I just plonked my room key down and said I had to go, having already given a credit card as a guarantee on arrival. At first nothing happened. I was sitting in a taxi about to set off when one of the clerks rushed out and accused me of trying to leave without paying the bill. The room was pre-paid, so all this fuss was for a few bottles of water from the minibar and one light lunch. Didn't leave one with a good feeling. The clerk was unable to explain why the card they'd already had was unacceptable, and I used the same one when I went back inside.

Reviews.Title: “good location”
Reviews.Author: wardlawlifecoach
Reviews.Content: Stayed in this hotel for 4 nights. It is clean, staff are friendly, but only negative is hot breakfasts were never hot. This is not a hotel with a wow factor, but fine for the price. What it has going for it is location. Only a 10 minute walk to the beach, 5 minutes to a great shopping centre with supermarket, cinema and good restaurants. Also, number 14 bus from just outside gets you to the city centre in 15 minutes for only 2 euro. I will stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Frank-Carol-Yeshua
Reviews.Content: I am in our room(315) getting ready to check out and so I thought I would take the time to post this review while everything is still fresh in my mind. First let me say that the people who work here are very helpful and friendly. From the front desk personal all the way to the ladies who clean the rooms, they are all very professional. As for the hotel..it is very clean and in a very good location. It is only a 15 minute bus(14) ride to downtown Barcelona. We did have a problem with the A/C which in the afternoon couldn't keep the room cool. The management did offer to move us to better room. The ice maker machine on the 3rd floor doesn't work so I had to walk down to the 2nd floor. The breakfast price is a bit high by our standards. But all in all we did enjoy our stay at Hotel Icaria and we recommend it if you ever visit Barcelona you won't be disappointed.

Reviews.Title: “Honeymoon”
Reviews.Author: RMcK_12
Reviews.Content: We stayed here to start of our honeymoon a few days R & R before heading on our RCI Cruise. The hotel itself is lovely nice rooms breakfast was good. But there was very few sun beds around the pool so we never got to lounge by it. We walked to the beach a few days about a 10min walk and when i booked it I specifically asked for a hotel near/in the centre as we love all the nightlife but it couldnt be more wrong had to get a taxi in every night and pay usually 15-20 euros at the start and usually 20euros on the back. If your looking for a quiet break then this is for you sadly not for us.

Reviews.Title: “Good Location”
Reviews.Author: Mike20122012
Reviews.Content: Chose this hotel because of it's location near to the Razzmatazz club for a Noel Gallegher concert. It's a ten minute stroll to Port Olympic's many bars and restaurants and the same to Razzmatazz in the opposite direction. The hotel itself is modern and clean with a nice outside pool and bar area which I would imagine would be really nice during the warmer months, not so useful for our March visit! There is an underground car park but there is also plenty of free parking in the roads around the hotel. Was great value and would consider staying again.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely Hotel, Would Recommend and Will Return to Icaria Hotel Again”
Reviews.Author: Amandamanx
Reviews.Content: The Icaria Hotel is pretty nice, and as said by a previous Review with a little fine tuning it really could be absolutely spot on! We took a taxi from the airport to the hotel - took about 20 mins and was 32 Euros. We did the same on the way back to the airport - there is always a taxi either outside the hotel, or not very far away, so getting a taxi wasn't a problem. We arrived on the 1st March for 3 nights, so you are still looking at it being pretty quiet at this time. Check in at the Hotel is pretty slow as far as check-ins go, I really don't know why it was so slow, they just seemed to take ages in dealing with every Customer, it was slow for us, and we also noticed it on several occasions when new guests arrived, I would imagine it would be pretty chaotic when really busy. But, Reception staff particularly the ladies were very helpful and friendly, the male receptionists weren't quite so user friendly!! We have stayed in both the Junior Suite and the Jacuzzi Suite and if you are torn between which one to book! Go for the Jacuzzi Suite - gorgeous. Very large bright room with massive super king bed, mirrored walls, and large Jacuzzi Bath. One point about the bathrooms which I think could be improved on is that they have a soap dispenser on the wall and a shamphoo/shower gel dispenser in the shower (both of which were hopeless and never worked, despite being full), the dispensers are pretty tacky and I think toileteries would be a nicer touch - or dispensers that worked? The Jacuzzi Suite was on the 6th floor and pretty quiet, but, the Junior Suite was on the 3rd Floor, and we found the road noise pretty noticable, the traffic never stops outside the hotel. We stayed Bed and Breakfast, I was surprised at the variety on offer at breakfast - very good, although, the cooked breakfast items were usually just pretty luke warm. One thing that was a little strange is that the bar is in the breakfast/restaurant room, so, we did find that of an evening it lacked in atmosphere, I think if they invested in a separate bar area it would be more appealing, you almost felt like you were having a drink in a cafeteria. The outside Pool area is nice, particularly the large gazebos with comfy sofas, although pretty cold of a night, perhaps some heaters would be nice out there? The swimming pool water was absolutely ice cold, no way was anyone going to be using it, Jacuzzi in the same area, and a small gym with sauna and steam room. Again, this area is a bit weird, no proper changing rooms, you had to get changed in the toilet, you are not allowed into the hotel in swim wear, so you have to get changed at the pool area, although there isnt really anywere allocated to get changed. There are 3 computers in the reception area, which are free for guests to use for upto 15 mins per time, which is really handy, we did out on-line check in on these and they even printed out boarding cards for us. All in all a lovely hotel, which was absolutely spotlessly clean - I dont think you could have found a speck of dust or muck if you crawled around all day long on your hands and knees! - so well done to the Cleaners - excellent job - would definately return and would recommend this hotel - not right in the centre of things, a block away from the beach and a good 15/20mins walk into City Centre.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: meromh
Reviews.Content: hotel is great, location is a bit away from everything.

Reviews.Title: “Nice location. Management needs focus on the little things....”
Reviews.Author: Blueskyguy
Reviews.Content: Icaria is a decent mid-range hotel, a block from the beach, and a few blocks from Barceloneta. The location provided great access for strolling along the beautiful and bustling Barcelona coastline. We stayed at Icaria during a major event in the city, and paid premium prices. The hotel, however, struggled with the "small stuff" that makes the difference between an enjoyable stay and a slightly frustrating one. Toiletries were not refilled once used (and even after requesting from the front desk); the hot water was out one morning; the breakfast buffet food was often cold; the laundry service was ridiculously expensive. With a bit of fine tuning, this could be a very nice place - hope the management gets on top of things.

Reviews.Title: “Saggy squeaky beds”
Reviews.Author: MagicDawn
Reviews.Content: The beds were old and saggy. We had a twin room. My bed sloped off to the left and my friend's squeaked very loudly every time she moved a muscle. We could feel the springs in the mattresses. The pillows were hard, lumpy and very deep. I had to go and buy a travel pillow to use for my 3 night stay, as the first night there I slept little and woke with a painful neck. I was very disappointed with the overall quality of the rooms. Our first room, despite being on the non-smoking floor, had been used by a smoker. The receptionist changed the room immediately. I know hotels in Barcelona aren't cheap, but for what we paid I had assumed we would get a quality nights sleep. The weather was warm and sunny (18 degrees) and the airconditioning system would only heat our room..to a huge 26 degrees...no cold air was possible. This meant sleeping with the window open all night, with loud traffic outside our window. We were on the street side of the hotel. We didn't have breakfast. The hotel website stated that if you had booked your room more than 20 days in advance that breakfast was free for your stay. We had booked 7 weeks in advance via Booking.com and were told we were not entitled to the free breakfast as we had not booked directly through the hotel. The hotel is 20 minutes by bus from La Ramblas. Adjustable lighting in the room - we never mastered that. In our 4 day stay. Standard naff hotel hairdryer that takes forever to dry your hair. Lovely hot tub. We ran the Barcelona Half Marathon and had a lovely 2 hour soak in the hot tub. This was the deciding factor on choosing this hotel over others. Pool not warm enough to use at this time of year. If it's too cold for children it's definitely too cold for adults! Noce outdoor seating area for lunch or drinks. Amazing burger and chips! Staff friendly and helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Helpful staff”
Reviews.Author: sandersandrew
Reviews.Content: We stayed for one night as a couple. There was an odd situation in that as we arrived we were behind two gents who had attempted to book a room for 2 but a reservation had been made for one - we noticed that we had the same problem. I'm not sure if we had missed something on their website, or perhaps there is a technical problem. Anyway, the staff at reception were very helpful and sorted out the problem for us. The hotel is a short walk from the Ciutadella via Olympica (excuse my spelling) on the yellow metro line, which you can pick up in the city centre. There are no real street signs that are immediately obvious, but when you come out of the metro station, you basically head straight up the road that is almost directly in front of you - this is Avinguda Icaria. There is a large shopping centre with a supermarket and a few dining options inside (as well as a cinema) close to the hotel, on the opposite side of the road. The hotel is pretty nice and clean. Our room was also clean and the facilities were all very clean and functional. The area is quite quiet, although our hotel neighbours (ie the other residents) were loud and made a great deal of noise arriving back at night. It is only a short journey into central Barcelona from the hotel on the metro line - although you could also take the promenade along the beach past the yachts to Barceloneta and the bottom of Las Ramblas.

Reviews.Title: “No bad but could be much better....”
Reviews.Author: fra1973
Reviews.Content: No bad overall the hotel.nice lobby.good breakfast.too noisy the family room in front of the elevator.the sauna and the fitness are across the outside pool and when is cold is a problem to get there walking outside.anyway a good hotel that i suggest!is also very close to the beach.

Reviews.Title: “Good price”
Reviews.Author: Ela M
Reviews.Content: This was good hotel for good price. The rooms are beautiful and have everything you need. The spa is really good too! It is a hotel not too far from the center of Barcelona and very close to the beach! My only compliant was the room service meals, not so in my favor but the food in the restraurant downstairs was very good.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay”
Reviews.Author: Bjorn P
Reviews.Content: Great value. Close to the beach and restaurants. Rooms are great and people are friendly. i go to Barcelona almost every week for work and for me this hotel provides a place where I can meet people, get work done, and be comfortable.

Reviews.Title: “Close to beach...Why prefer this hotel?”
Reviews.Author: Teja R
Reviews.Content: I went during weekdays...its was good close beach and olympic port area most of the clubs and restaurants are around there...Receptionists speak good English and hard working. They literally manage everything...i went there like 1000times still they had good patience...Make full use of jacuzzi, spa and gym its free....

Reviews.Title: “JUST WHAT WE WANTED”
Reviews.Author: georgiaanteneyhoare
Reviews.Content: 3 of us stayed in Icaria Hotel Bracelona for 2 nights whilst on a city break in Barcelona. the hotel met all our needs and at an excellent price. We booked a triple room and it was excellent with sufficient space and comfortable beds even the 3rd as not a sofa but an actual bed. The hotel was however about a 15 minute walk from the nearest metro stop although this was fine it did take us a while to figure out where the hotel was when travelling from the airport. A taxi to and from the airport was around €30-€35 which was worth it on the way back and we had an early start. The only thing to be weary about is the PICKPOCKETS I had been in Barelona half an hour before someone tried to steal my purse luckily I noticed and the man ran off. Overall we had an excellent stay in the Icaria and would recommend it for those looking for quality with a low budget.

Reviews.Title: “excellent choise”
Reviews.Author: angelocyp
Reviews.Content: Stayed there for a week in January at a very reasonable price. The staff were very polite and helpful, the rooms clean and the breakfast excellent. It's in a very convenient area away from the noisy center but close enough to everywhere really. The bus stops for both the Touristic Bus and the Public Buses are only a few meters away. Only one small complaint- even though the wifi is free, its signal is very week. I would definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Off the beatin' path”
Reviews.Author: WaywardTravelor
Reviews.Content: We ended up at Icaria on recommendation after the hotel we booked (3 stars) ended up being a dump. We were happy to upgrade to Icaria the only draw back is location. Hotel Icaria is very clean and modern. The only draw back is that it is far from the tourist areas and at least 1/2 a mile (1km) from the Metro. The bus stop is right around the corner. I do not like taking buses to get to the Metro to get to where I am going. If you stay here you will need a Metro pass. Like others stated, get the 10 pass ticket. Little known fact: you can use the 10 pass for more than one person by passing it back after the first person crosses the barrier. Perfectly legal! We even did this right in front of Metro security with no issues. The Metro pass will get you from the airport to where ever your hotel is, even on the bus as long as you do not exceed 75 minutes. Going from the airport train to the metro (and back) is a little hairy but do able with light luggage. During summer the Icaria Hotel's area is probably better as the hotel is only one bock from the beach. We went in January so the beach was not of much use, although my morning runs were beautiful on the nearly vacant boardwalks.

Reviews.Title: “Decent hotel, close to the beach but a bit far from the city center”
Reviews.Author: Shashmi
Reviews.Content: We had booked the hotel thinking it was close to the city center, but turned out its not. Definitely the beach is very close by, but we went in January so it wasnt of great use. The hotel is about 15 mins walk from the nearest metro station indeed not a 2 mins walk (as indicated on some other reviews). Alternatively, You can get a bus from right outside the metro and the hotel is just 2 stops away. The actual location of the hotel isn’t great, the ally next to the hotel has car repair and other mechanic shops and looks like a sad place. On the positive side, the city sighseeing bus comes just around the corner so if you plan to take that tour you can board the bus from walking distance. Note there are two different operators running the open-top sight-seeing bus service and our general observation was that frequency on the tour operated bycitysightseeing.com was lesser than the other one. Coming back to the hotel review, the interiors of the hotel are good, the reception staff were nice, we liked the outdoor swimming pool and the pool side table setting – note the hotel charges 3 euros per person for towels supplied at the pool (this is for the entire trip as opposed to 3 euro per swim). The room itself was nice, we got a pool facing room but it also overlooked upon nearby residences and shops. The room was spacious, and the amenities and room service were excellent. The first day we had ordered dinner in the room, enjoyed the food, and the almond cake was awesome :) The breakfast options were good as well, they had lot many options to choose from. Overall it was a good experience, not an extravagant 4 star hotel, but if you are looking for just a comfy room away from the hustle-bustle of the city center and still easily connected to the city you will like Hotel Icaria.

Reviews.Title: “Manish Thapa”
Reviews.Author: Manishthapa293890
Reviews.Content: It is a great hotel. We are very happy with our room and the service they provided to us. Friendly staffs, prompt service as well as calm atmosphere is what it attracted us. The hotel is 2 blocks from the beach and you can catch a bus to center from just the corner. The city tour bus is also within 200 meters. and above all it is on a very quite environment which is the best aspect of this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “medium”
Reviews.Author: Pawel_EPWR
Reviews.Content: Beach is only 5 min. Receptionist was friendly and spoke good english. The room was clean and clean towels every morning. Breakfast buffet was poor, compared to other hotels we have stayed in. Food menu was very expensive, limited choice. No tea coffe in room. Parking was too expensive, no airporter service.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, but a 7-10 minute walk to the nearest Metro.”
Reviews.Author: phogsky
Reviews.Content: The rooms are very nice, clean, and modern. The staff is very welcoming and helpful. Everything about the place is nice and seem to be worth the value. The only negative is that it does take a little walk to get to the Metro. There are 3 Metro Stops all equidistant from the hotel. I may be spoiled, because I don't like taking buses. Buy at the same time I avoid using Taxis. Overall great!

Reviews.Title: “Icaria Hotel, Barcelona”
Reviews.Author: joebloggs j
Reviews.Content: Excellent Hotel, Friendly and worth a visit. Make sure you take advantage of the pool and spa area. Staff very helpful and friendly. Close to city centre

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: PIKEYno1
Reviews.Content: Myself, my Wife and 2 kids aged 12 & 8 stayed here for 3 nights over New Years Eve. We had booked a family suite for our stay, but upon our arrival, we were told that all the suites were gone. I think this was because of our late arrival from Dublin due to the delay with our flight. The hotel gave us adjoining rooms on the 4th floor, rooms 412-413. These rooms had one main door entrance at the end of the hall, and two excellent rooms leading from this door. The kids could not believe they had their own room, TV, safe and toilet to themselves. They felt like little adults but beware of the mini bar as our 8 year old daughter thought all her birthdays had come at once. The staff were excellent and polite, and nothing was too much trouble for them. Close to promenade, and beautiful walk to Ramblas etc.

Reviews.Title: “Almost Perfect”
Reviews.Author: Gumbetoldtimer
Reviews.Content: This is a very good hotel, good location, very clean, good rooms, helpful staff. Close to the beach and very near to a bus stop. Just one small complaint I like a cup of tea in the morning with milk & it was very difficult to get them to put milk in the room. Apart from that everything was perfect.

Reviews.Title: “Stay”
Reviews.Author: jmmlee
Reviews.Content: Excellent room and facilities. We were really pleased. Just a small thing: it was practically impossible to get shower gel out of the dispensers, perhaps that could be addressed..? Thanks for a lovely stay

Reviews.Title: “poor quality service”
Reviews.Author: Gabor240
Reviews.Content: The hotel is located not far from the beach, but defenietly not walking distance from any tourist attraction. Public transport is a way to get around if you choose this hotel. The area itself is mixed, I guess it used to be an industrial area and it was partially renovated for the olympics. The hotel itself is nice and clean (apart from the gym, the pool and the sauna which were in a not acceptable condition), room is okay. Breakfast was good, but the restaurant was very cold (march) while at dinner we had to wait an awful lot of time for the waiter to get the orders and for the food as well... There were some misunderstandings with the reservation and the staff was showing no felxibility at all that was a bit annoying.

Reviews.Title: “nice hotel, very ignorant security”
Reviews.Author: dubliner57
Reviews.Content: A group of us stayed here at the start of October. The facilities are nice and the staff at the desk are very pleasant, but there is one middle-aged man working security for most the day who is the most ignorant person I have ever come across. During our 5 days here he gave out to myself and a friend for talking too loud in the swimming pool at 3 o clock in the day even though there was nobody else around! I also witnessed him having a go at several other guests for ridiculously petty things. Having a drink at the bar was very uncomfortable for many guests as he was constantly standing watching you, and if you got up to use the restroom he would watch to see where you were going! From talking to many other guests they all had the same experience. I would never stay in this hotel again because of this man.

Reviews.Title: “Vacation in October 2011”
Reviews.Author: jlusic
Reviews.Content: We were in Barcelona from 09.10 - 16.10.2011. The whether was perfect, somedays even too warm. Hotel has great location - 5 minutes from the beach, 2 minutes from the bus station, 5 -10 minute walk to Metro (Villa Olimpica). From there,5 minute to centre (Plaza Catalunya). Just perfect! Rooms were great,just enough space and big bathroom. Although, we were in the room with the view to the street, we didn't hear nothing! The staff was excellent-kind,warm and friendly! Special thanks to the girls at the reception! Breakfast was great - wide variety of foods which was very satisfying to us! Our experience in the hotel was overall excellent, but still we feel that we need to mention several things that need improvement: -wireless is not available in all rooms -service in the bar is very slow (we noticed the same thing in all bars and restaurants - maybe is just the way of life :) ). -in the bathroom, there is a big unused space for shells for examples (just one or two for girls makeup, parfums and etc.). To conclude, we are very happy we have choose hotel ICARIA for our stay in Barcelona and we would visit the same again, if we have such opportunity ;). Thank you for your hospitality:) Josko and Katarina Lusic from Zagreb,Croatia

Reviews.Title: “First class service and quality experience”
Reviews.Author: suarezforever
Reviews.Content: Took a long time picking this and pleased with the result. Close to the beach and olympic port and not far to city centre and attractions by bus and metro. Very clean everything works well food nice and service excellent. My son even used the pool in the dark!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent”
Reviews.Author: Christine L
Reviews.Content: For the second time, i visited your hotel. We really like the situation, because it's close to the beach and the distance to the centre ( ramblas ) is also very good. Or you can make a walk along the beach and the port, or you can take the bus 41. The hotel is very clean and nice, the rooms large , and a wonderfull bathroom. We had also a perfect breakfastbuffet ! When we came back in the late afternoon, we had a drink at the terrace beside the swimming pool , we really enjoyed our holiday very much. We will surely come back again, but then we will ask a room with view on the swimming pool, and not beside the street. That was the only problem, it was very noisy in the night of the trafic and the people in the night.

Reviews.Title: “Cold”
Reviews.Author: Oestergaard
Reviews.Content: We vere visiting easter 2011. The reasturant was cold. the food was average. The pool ok, but you had to change at the room. It was not allowed to wear swimsuit in the elevator....We got a room with moisture on the walls from the window and down to the floor. We were not sattiesfied and got a new room. The hotel is situatet near the beach and bus. in a calm area.

Reviews.Title: “As good as it gets...”
Reviews.Author: WillHamilton
Reviews.Content: This is really nice and as good as it gets at this price. I can see why it is so popular. Staff are friendly and helpful; we arrived early Saturday am before check in and so they locked our bags away while we went out. The pool is cold but refreshing and there is a hot tub next to it. The bar is lovely with an ouside terrace. The rooms are modern and smart and the bathrooms amazing. We had the two rooms at the end of a corridor with another door across the width of the corridor so we could leav our doors open to talk to each other. The breakfast is reallgood; there is an enormous spread. My only criticism of the entire stay is that the scrambled eggs were only lukewarm; maybe nobody turned on the warming dish!! It's a short walk down to the beach with its lovely restaurants right by the sand. We walked back from the Ramblas on Sunday. It's not far from anywhere! I'll be back!

Reviews.Title: “Close to beach...”
Reviews.Author: Kiwitraveller1983
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel for my boyfriend's birthday and we very happy with it! I had requested a bottle of white wine for the room as a suprise for my boyfriend...the wine was brought up to the room about 10minutes after we checked in (it was red but the lady was only to happy to swap it for white as I had requested). The beach is only about a 5minute walk away and the water is crystal clear-the hotel lends you towels for the duration of your stay for 3 euros which is much better than having to pack towels. Reception staff were very friendly and only too happy to help. The room was larger than I expected with a big bathroom and it was of a high standard. As mentioned in the last review the metro is 10mins walk and the buses 41 and 14 stop very close to the hotel which both go to the centre of the city. We had the same experience with the coffee and milk...I asked every day for more coffee sachets and the man who was in the bar did not seem overly pleased to oblige. The hop on hop off bus also stops around the corner from the hotel. We had a couple of snacks at the hotel which were nice but did not eat breakfast there. We chose this hotel because of the close proximity to the beach and we were not disappointed! We would definitely stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing, great value hotel”
Reviews.Author: Jen N
Reviews.Content: I went to this hotel in September 2010 with my boyfriend. We had a fantastic time there and have nothing to complain about at all. We booked it through a superbreak deal and got a really good offer which I don't think exists anymore but if it did I'm sure we'd definitely go back. The hotel was much nicer than we thought it would be for the price we paid and we were amazed at the standard as soon as we walked in. The room is a great size and was very clean and the bathroom was also lovely. The pool area was great and was never too busy. The staff were all friendly and helpful and we used room service a couple of times which was also excellent. We stayed at the hotel for 7 nights and for us, the location was perfect. The nearest metro station is only a 10 minute walk and it takes 5 or 10 minutes to get to the centre of Barcelona. It is an amazing city with so much to do but we felt it was nice to go back to the quieter area of the Olympic port at night out of the business of the centre of Barcelona. There are good places to eat and nice areas to go for a walk at the beach. During the day you can spend your time sightseeing using the metro or having a relaxing time at the pool or beautiful beach 5 minutes away so you get the best of both worlds. However, if you are staying for a shorter time you may prefer a more central location. I'd also recommend a visit to the Parc de la Ciutadella which is about a 15 minute walk from the hotel and is near the houses of parliament and the zoo. There is a small shopping centre nearby that has a good supermarket across the road from the hotel too. With all this to do we didn't get to try out the spa facilities unfortunately. We would love to go back!!

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel and good location”
Reviews.Author: sarahknny
Reviews.Content: We stayed here in september, there was 8 girls in total. The hotel itself was lovely, really nice staff and the rooms were spacious and spotlessly clean (especially the pool area they were constantly cleaning this which is a really good sign to me!). The pool area was nice although it was shaded until after 1pm, due to the highrise buildings surrounding it. The location was excellent we were only a five minute walk away from the beach, resturants and pubs and clubs. The only negative really was we arrived home one night to sit in the resident bar which was supposed to be open until 3am and this was 2am but they were closing up, but with all due respect the girl behind the bar said she would sell us beer or shorts but no cocktails and that we had to drink them in our room which was ok with us. Overall it was a very pleasent experience, clean rooms, pleasent staff and great location what more could you want.

Reviews.Title: “Noreen Ireland”
Reviews.Author: Noreentm
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from a week in the Hotel Icaria. The Reception Staff were excellent and gave us a quiet room as requested. We found the staff always ready to give directions and were very helpful. Amy in the dining room was delightful and is a great ambassador for the hotel. There was a very good selection of food at breakfast. The rooms were very clean and the linen and towels were changed daily. We didn't use the metro as the 14 and 41 buses stopped outside the hotel and went to the city centre. It was very convenient to the beach and resturaunts. A shopping Centre with Cinema (films in English) and a supermarket is a five minute walk from the hotel. We felt the area was very safe and would have no hesitation in staying there again if in Barcelona. Thanks Icaria!

Reviews.Title: “hotel icaria barcelona”
Reviews.Author: Trevor C
Reviews.Content: Modern hotel built we believe for the 1992 Olympics. Reception staff spoke excellent English and were peasant and helpful Staying two nights after cruise and arriving at 10.30am we were allowed immediate acces to the large air conditioned room with hugh bathroom and walk in shower, pool facing and quiet. Our 2 day package included breakfast at an inclusive cost of 108 euros per room night.A good choice of cold and hot food but unfortunately the hot food wasn,t. There was also a problem in finding crockery for late risers as tables remained uncleared The pool was clean and popular with too many 'reserved' sunbeds from early morning although the sun didn't reach the pool area until after mid day Ate in the hotel the first night with a reasonably priced menu well presented. The hotel is on;y a short strol from a lovely beach and the Olympic sailing harbour with many fish and tapas restaurants. The number 14 and 41 buses stop close to the hotel for access to the centre of Barcelona and the route show many of the sites. The hotel offers luggage storage for late departures We would definately use this hotel again

Reviews.Title: “fantastic hotel”
Reviews.Author: Dan L
Reviews.Content: Just got back from a week long stay and the hotel was faultless. Not sure what the below review is complaining about as I found the reception staff were extremely polite and helpful, room was spacious, cool, quiet, comfortable and clean. Beach towels at 3 euros for your entire stay definately doesnt seem unreasonable to me. There was a bus stop right outside the hotel which was served regularly and meant a quick 10 minute ride to the centre of town (La Ramblas/Pl Catalunya). The hotel was a 2 minute walk from a very nice beach. There's a supermarket 1 minute up the road so you can stock up on food and drink for a cheap picnic on the beach. Free wifi throughout the hotel was slightly temperamental but it was free so can't really complain. There's also 3 computers for guests to use in the lobby, very useful for looking for things to do in the city and printing things such as boarding passes. To top off a fantastic hotel there was also a beautiful pool, hot tub, sauna, steamroom and gym which were perfect for relaxing after a day of walking the city (which incidentally didn't seem to merit all the concern about safety - just act as though you would in any city and you'll be fine) Already recommended the hotel to family and if I ever go back to Barcelona it will be the first place I look for.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointed the reviews are not accurate”
Reviews.Author: MissieMom07
Reviews.Content: This hotel is run down and in a bad part of town for safetly and cultrue. As for the important stuff the beds were so so the linens were nice though, but the shower was aweful it would get really cold and then scolding hot randomly.I would have rated it just averate because i got a good rate on the hotel but the less than helpful and honest staff made it a poor rating. We asked a non smoking room and was put in a smoking one anyways and when we asked the staff they lied and said we were in non smoking yet the whole floor was smoking. Then when our AC in the room wasn't working the front desk said they would send someone immediatly but after 3 hours of nothing we went to bed and when we asked again in the morning the front desk, same person, said she didn't know what we were talking about and that there was not a a service call for our room. I should have known we were in from trouble when at check in despite the fact that we were the only people in the lobby we had to wait until the two receptionists were done giggling and joking with eachother and then still didn't even ask us if we needed anything standing infront of them holding all our luggage. The area is bad and extremly unsafe as well it is a 10 minute walk to the closest metro and the streets are lined with cops and people have been hit in the cross walks here! There is no where to eat worth while over on this side of town. The beach is just across the street which is why we stayed here and it was the only highlight, but if you need a beach towel which you will becasue they claim they will cancel you reservation if you take a room towel to the pool or beach, you haveto rent if ro 3 euros a towel! What service!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic hotel for families”
Reviews.Author: Leeca1
Reviews.Content: Stayed in this hotel for a few days and its really stunning, pool area fab, Bar area lovely, do great cocktails, food is lovely and very reasonable priced, would def recommend this hotel

Reviews.Title: “Nice location, modern hotel, with some flaws”
Reviews.Author: Oaltun
Reviews.Content: Good hotel in an ideal location between port olympic party nights, the beach and the center. We were overall happy, however there were some small problems: 1. The wireless internet does not work in the corner rooms, so ask for a room close to the elevators if you will need it 2. there was no shower gel - cleaning forgot to replace the big bottle. Not a nice surprise at 2am in the shower.. 3. The breakfast could be better 4. The bed was too hard - had a stiff shoulder the next day

Reviews.Title: “Very nice clean hotel”
Reviews.Author: Andy G
Reviews.Content: The hotel is very close to the beach and it is very clean. A nice patio area out the back for sunbathing and using the pool. The staff were very helpful and overall well worth the money.

Reviews.Title: “The smells were aufull!”
Reviews.Author: StefT
Reviews.Content: The biggest drawback, and hence the low scores we give this hotel on cleanliness and comfort, was the terrible smell of both the 6th floor passage and the rooms themselves. We were, appreciatively, upgraded to suites on the Hotel's top floor, yet the smell of cigarettes (we think) was unpleasant, pervasive and completely over-powered us and our kids. Also, the general condition of the carpets in the foyer was not great. In addition, the air-conditioning could have worked a lot better and the soap dispensers in the suite just did not allow for enough, and ease of, soap to be dispensed, which was frustrating. On the positive side, the hotel was located well within easy reach of the beach and the staff were extremely helpful - something we did not generally experience in Spain.

Reviews.Title: “We won't return to Icaria”
Reviews.Author: edew4
Reviews.Content: We stayed in hotel Icaria for a week. I would not recommend this hotel and do not think it is worth 4 stars. Our room was not ready when we arrived at 10 pm(!); At last the extra bed was ready, but on the nightstand we spotted an empty cereals box and in the closet a half eaten bag of nuts, from the previous guests. After two nights without sleep because of the noise of our neighbours (french teens) and early mornings because of the broken curtains (light), we moved to a better room. But still: the hotel is very noisy. The mattresses are very hard and uncomfortable. The reception staff is nice but the waiters (breakfast and terrace) are very unpleasant, almost rude.(exception: Fouzia). If they don't like to serve people why do they choose a job in the hotel and catering industry? They hardly greeted, it seemed like you had to be grateful to get a drink, when ordering a cup of coffee the saucer was full of coffee, they charged double and we were rudely approached when one of my daughters dared to drink a brought can of coke which she had not ordered in the bar. Regarding the fact that the terrace is the only possibility to sit outside (no balcony) and regarding the prices this is not very guest friendly, when the terrace is almost empty. And yes, the soap dispensers were not refilled, the one downstairs, next to the terrace and restaurant remained empty during our stay. The music played in the breakfast room is horrible and they play the same songs over and over. The positive comments I can make are about the reception, fresh fruit at breakfast and the location, near to the very nice and quiet beach and near to the busstop to the city center (14, 41). We won't return.

Reviews.Title: “Nice modern hotel”
Reviews.Author: fifidIreland
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this hotel for 1 night before, embarking on a cruise. hotel spotlessly clean and very modern. Free wi-fi. We were upgraded to a suite {free of charge} which was lovely and spacious. Very quiet at night no entertainment, which did not bother us too much as we were only staying for 1 night, and had an early start next morning. Only thing I can fault is the breakfast next morning, which was jusy okay. Fiona.

Reviews.Title: “Location perfect, hotel ok.”
Reviews.Author: edmar1971
Reviews.Content: Our stay at Icaria for a short city trip was okay. The location is near the beach and a lot of restaurants. Perfect boulevard for a walk after busy day in the big city! breakfast was good room was good, except there was no soap, the dispensors were broken. We asked kindly at the reception and someone from housekeeping came directly. She told us she could not repair it and left. Was not repaired in the 3 days we stayed here. swimming pool was too small for too many people, it also needed some maintanance and cleaning. Parking was flooded. At night a lot of noise I guess from people coming back from a night out.

Reviews.Title: “If Carlsberg did hotels...”
Reviews.Author: CorynneC
Reviews.Content: Having read some bad reviews about the receptionist staff, I was somewhat skeptical about meeting them. However, I have no trouble in admitting they were some of the kindest and most helpful hotel staff I've ever met. The only staff in the hotel that didn't provide an 5-star service was the breakfast host. I am aware that the breakfast rush is a stressful time for the hotel, but his mannerisms were rather curt and by comparison to his co-workers, his work/efforts were sub-standard. The room itself was gorgeous. Spacious, clean and just beautiful. My only complaints here were the following: 1. The light fitting over the desk was broken. Also hung low so my (tall) friend kept hitting his head on it. 2. The 'Double Bed' was actually two singles pushed together, which was fine, but, while not an issue for this trip, obviously one could not sleep near a companion. 3. The mini-bar was not fully stocked with everything that was on the list. 4. There was no 'intro pack' in the room. No information about pool times, dinner times, numbers to call for reception, no TV channel listing. Also only 1-2 channels were in English, which is fair enough, but it would've been nice if we could have taken advantage of the technology in the room. The TV also had no USB port, which would be nice. Again, these are only minor complaints and nothing that detracted from the actual experience. Personally, I loved the location. It was one of my favourite parts about this hotel. It was so close to the beach (2mins to Bogatell/Nova Icaria), and when you realise how compact Barcelona is, not at all far from the city centre either. It was ideal for me because it was quiet. The swimming pool was also very nice. It doesn't however have a "shallow end" and a "deep end". It just gets a bit deeper in the middle. I'd recommend putting up some safety and warning signs. I saw many children, and even some adults diving into it. For something as shallow as that, it really is an accident waiting to happen. While I understand why, it was a shame that the jacuzzi and pool close at 9pm. 10pm would be fairer, I think. It would give the adults some time to enjoy it without all the children around. Also, a few more loungers wouldn't go amiss. Lastly, 'The Vanity Room' Cocktail Bar was absoloutely stunning and the adjoining terrace was a pleasure to sit in. However, I was disappointed by the lack of variety in the cocktails. There were approx. eight. Not exactly what I would have imagined in such a high class bar. I would most certainly stay here again on a return trip to Barcelona.

Reviews.Title: “Second Visit - and still excellent”
Reviews.Author: Alexander028
Reviews.Content: Second visit. Excellent standards maintained here. Well managed. Don't see how anyone can fault the reception staff - they were considerate, helpful and kind at all times with us and we had our cases carried to the taxi on departure. They take no nonsense from anyone who spoils enjoyment of others. Witnessed three male teens (French) getting a massive telling off about something they did by the pool, just short of being ejected. The place is spotless and efficient. Great buffet breakfast. Main lunch/dinner menu is very limited but well-cooked. Cross the road for the beach and Port Olympic; turn right for the city. Metro is about 10 minutes to the right, just before the Zoo. Consume supermarket to the right. It's an upmarket trendy residential area and is very quiet.

Reviews.Title: “Thumbs up”
Reviews.Author: Jetsetterlover
Reviews.Content: Good location to the beach! Not far to central by metro Rooms are big and clean! Definitely would recommend! Nothing to fault this hotel

Reviews.Title: “Nice place!!!.”
Reviews.Author: Quimico40
Reviews.Content: Good place for families and solo staying. Good conections to donwntown by bus, metro a little far. Nice staff. Breakfast good, but allways same food. A´l carte menu was good too, but only few choices on whole week. Swimming pool is for children, very small. In general is nice hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Couldn't get any better”
Reviews.Author: gmp123
Reviews.Content: The best hotel in Barcelona regarding location. It is situated in the middle of the city, bit more quiet and safer than city center locations...very close to the beach, to diagonal mar shopping center, to la rambla city center, in a few words...close to everything that Barcelona has to offer.... Great service, clean rooms and towels every day, mini bar, free internet access or computer use...elevators work only with room key so its safer, nice spacious bathroom etc etc....Stayed there twice and would stay there again! A+...would recommend!!

Reviews.Title: “Good location, awful reception staff”
Reviews.Author: sergeyvzn
Reviews.Content: This hotel is great if you want to combine sightseeing with a bit of beach holiday, it's about 3 mins from the beach of Nueva Icaria, walk out, cross Icaria Avenue, walk along the pedestrian bridge and there you are. The greet route of Barcelona's hop-on/hop-off bus is in 50 meters and if you want to go to the centre, there is a bus stop just outside the hotel Nice comfortable rooms, great amenities, free wi fi and a great breakfast However, their reception staff was bad, when I arrived and walked to the reception, I was met by a surly sitting girl who said she'd finished her shift and I had to wait for her colleague to show up! All the while browsing something on the computer...if this happened in Australia, she'd be sacked on the spot. My twin room request was not honoured, I was given a double room, of course. That was discovered when me and my mother (we were travelling together) went up to the room we were allocated. So I had to go down and ask for a twin room, pointing out my "twin room, please" request in the reservation. THe check-in girl said something in Spanish that sounded like "oh you funny tourists you make funny reservation requests that no one reads here anyway and you want your preferred bed type allocated upon check-in, dream on"...however, I got my twin room after all. Their breakfast guy was very unfriendly too, he checked and double checked my name to make sure I would get charged for the breakfast (it was not included in the rate), the next morning he made me stand and wait at the restaurant entrance desk while he was printing a breakfast docket for me to sign before I was even allowed to enter and sit down. Appalling service! The hotel is fine but needs to do something about its staff

Reviews.Title: “Close walk to the beach with a great pool”
Reviews.Author: Athena2003
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Hotel Icaria for one night upon arriving in Barcelona. This hotel is in the Port Vell and La Ribera area of the city away from the busy downtown. It was less than a 5 minute walk to the beaches and the pool was great. The employees at the front desk spoke some English, and we were permitted to check in a couple hours early. The only downfall of this hotel is it's location since it's so far from the heart of the city. Although a short walk from the beaches, it was 5-6 blocks to the metro, and a 20 minute walk to Barceloneta.

Reviews.Title: “The exellent Hotel that is worthy of the most beautiful city Barcelona!”
Reviews.Author: Vikt0r_P
Reviews.Content: We liked the hotel a lot. There are several minutes to the nice beach. A shopping center where one can get the essentials is situated nearby. It takes about 15 minutes to get to the subway however we considered that fact being an additional walk along amazing city. There is a very good service there. Breakfasts are superb and diverse. The hotel's swimming pool perfectly complements sea bathing. The "Bus Touristic" which has a stop near the hotel is a good way to see the places of interest of the city. We will certainly stay at this hotel next time we visit Barcelona.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: Mr_Matti
Reviews.Content: Very good breakfast. Swimming pool and jaguzzi were in heavy use (6 year old daughter + parents). Quiet and peacefull neighbourhood. Close to the beach. Helpfull people at reception. Only negative point was strange smell in our first room but problem disappeared when we changed the room

Reviews.Title: “relax, enjoy and make yourself comfortable”
Reviews.Author: funkygirl01
Reviews.Content: we really enjoyed our stay at the hotel. the room was clean, the staff very friendly and patient. they spoke very good english which is not that common in Barcelona! we did not take breakfast,lunch nor dinner at the hotel but went to local restaurants, bars etc.. which turned out cheaper for 3 single girls on a budget:-) all interesting areas to visit are within walking distance of the hotel but if you would want you can also take the metro which is 5 min away an very easy to use. And when you are tired of visiting this lovely vivedly city, you can relax at the hotel's swimming pool with a glass of excellent wine or cava! those were the days:-)

Reviews.Title: “Loved It - Would Recommend To Friends”
Reviews.Author: dferguson
Reviews.Content: Stayed there on 10 June 2011 with members of my family prior to going on a cruise. Ideally situated near to cruise terminal and not far away from city centre. Near to a bus stop for the Barcelona Tourist Hop On/Hop Off Bus and only 5E in a taxi to Las Ramblas. Rooms very spacious, clean and comfortable. Staff helpful and breakfast plentiful with a wide variety of food. Hotel is in a safe area and is good value compared to those in the centre near to Las Ramblas. Would highly recommend it to others.

Reviews.Title: “Spot on!”
Reviews.Author: Reesemeister
Reviews.Content: Spent a couple of nights at the hotel Icaria in June, the hotel is approx 20 mins transfer from BCN with a taxis costing approx 35 euros e/w. We were able to check-in at 11:30 althought the rooms weren't supposed to be ready until 14:00, the room was clean and spotless and nicely done, the views are a bit naff but that really wasn't an issue for us. The breakfast was great, lots of choice (hot, cold, fruit, cakes etc.) although it did tend to get busy round 10ish. The pool is a bit on the small side but with the sea a 5 min walk away again that really wasn't an issue, it also has a patio area alongside the pool which was quite handy, as we were able to sit and have a "few" drinks without hunting for loungers/chairs. As the Olympic port (10 mins walk) is just down the road, this is pretty handy for eating/drinking without having to go all the way to La Rambla. If you did want to go into Barcelona/La Rambla etc. then its approx a 30 min walk or an even easier option is to get the bus! During our stay not one of our party (13 of us) had anything but complimentary comments to say about the hotel, if I was coming back to Barcelona, I would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Base for Exploring Barcelona”
Reviews.Author: OAA_STL
Reviews.Content: Hotel Icaria is ideally situated for exploring the city as it's just out of the way enough to be peaceful at night and just close enough to the beach, one of the stops on the city bus tour, and the Metro to provide you access. The rooms in which I stayed were spacious, airy, and comfortable, and both were on the pool (back) side of the hotel which meant I could leave my large window open all night long. They do begin cleaning the pool area at a very early hour, but the only thing I noticed was the music they played while cleaning - mid-tempo Sting and Sinead O'Connor hits. Free WiFi was rather handy for email and Skype and Anna at the front desk was just delightful. Were I lucky enough to return to Barcelona, I would not hesitate to stay at Hotel Icaria again.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel, great location”
Reviews.Author: misstee83
Reviews.Content: Ater travelling for two days due to the volcanic ash delays, we finally made it and we were not disappointed. It is also important to mention here that the hotel did not charge us for the night we missed due to flight cancellation as we kept in touch with them and advised of our delayed arrival - this was an unexpected and pleasant surprise! The hotel is in a great location, five minutes from the lovely Icaria beach and a nice walk from the Olympic port and Marina. There are some lovely tapas and seafood restaurants and beach bars nearby, and staying here really made us feel as though we were on a relaxing beach holiday, despite being close to La Ramblas, Sagrada Familia, Parc Guell and and all the bustle of Barcelona. Taxis from here to the centre of town were frequent and cheap, as was the bus service that passed the hotel. We were here for the Primavera Sound festival, and were within half an hours walk from the venue, so would definitely stay here again if we return to the festival next year. The room was slightly small, but the bathroom was huge and well equipped, and the decor of both were lovely - could not complain at all about the cleanliness or appearance of this hotel, The pool was great, never too busy, as was the heated jacuzzi. The buffet breakfast, at 12 euros, was slilghtly expensive given that there are beach bars nearbv offering sandwiches for half that price, but had a good choice and ideal for filling up on before a long days sight seeing. We will definitely return to the Hotel Icaria - cannot fault it in any way.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic”
Reviews.Author: turner_nay
Reviews.Content: Excellent staff who were incredibly helpful and professional. Situated 3 minutes walk from the beach and on the main bus routes to all areas of interest. Lovely breakfast and cocktails. I will definitely use this hotel in the future.

Reviews.Title: “Ticked our boxes!”
Reviews.Author: shandy00
Reviews.Content: We arrived at the hotel on a Sunday afternoon. Taxi from the airport was 28Euros. We recieved a friendly welcome from the reception staff. Room 506 overlooks a road in a mainly residential area. The road is quite busy but the noise did not bother us. We enjoyed a tasty breakfast with a good choice. Although the food could have been somewhat hotter or served on heated plates. The reception staff advised us on transport into the heart of Barcelona, a bus 14 or 41 stops literally outside the door of the hotel, every 10-15 mins. A little further down the road there is a Tabac where one can purchase a bus ticket for around 7Euros, this will provide 10 seperate bus journeys, so excellent value for money. Ride into town is around 10-15 mins. On the way to town you pass the most amazing park, visit the park it is so beautiful, with amazing sculptres, water features and a boating lake. If you get the 92 bus opposite the hotel it will take you to Gaudi gardens (again with the bus pass) 40 mins and well worth a visit. On first arrival the hotel seems a little off the beaten track but the Icaria has the best of everything in my opinion. nice pool area, short ride to town, a stroll to the Olympic Port which has a lovely selections of restaurants. A cinema complex and restaurants over the road including Turkish, Chinese etc and a supermarket. Safe area, away from the hustle bustle of the Ramblas. The room had a slight technical problem with the TV and the staff couldn't have been more helpful. As the problem couldn't be repaired the reception sent chocolate covered strawberries, fruit and cava to the room. A really lovely touch. I would not hesitate to stay at the Icaria again and would reccomend it to anyone who is looking for a nice comfortable place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel & Staff”
Reviews.Author: UkMhamilton
Reviews.Content: Good service. Excellent breakfast, near to the beach. Ok, a bit far from town but Taxis and bus stops near to hand (only 15-20 minute walk to centre). Would happily stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Highs and Lows”
Reviews.Author: inntheknow
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for four nights and some experiances were good and some bad. The room overlooked the swiming pool at the rear of the hotel,was quiet and so we slept well. It had blackout curtains, mini bar, flat screen TV with 4 english channels,safe, good size bathroom with bath, shower and bidet. Our room had tea and coffee tray but the other three rooms did not! We asked for extra coat hangers and they arrived promptly. Breakfast had a wide choice of food, but everything was self service! As in most hotels the hot food was cold e.g. fried eggs,bacon (very fatty) and sausages (though they sometimes had two types) and cold plates. The breakfast room is a bit like a cafeteria. As in some of the restaurants they never put a cruet on the table! Service wise the female staff were excellent (especially Reception) but the male staff were very indifferent and even the Manager walked around, doing nothing in particular and talking to nobody! On the Friday evening we arrived back late and decided to eat in the hotel and were informed that there was only one chef on and there would be a 30 to 40 minute delay. The meal took two and a quarter hours and the main courses appeared sporadically (which happened in other restaurants as well!) The waiter then gave us as compensation four 10% discount cards to be used in the cocktail bar. The problem was that on the Saturday night it was closed for a private function and it closes on a Sunday and Monday! The food when it arrived was not that bad. Overall a mixed experiance. It is certainly not 4 star but a good 3 star one.Paid the same price as a 4 star hotel in London except we got breakfast which was a special offer on the web site. Had some excellent recommendations of local restaurants from the reception staff.

Reviews.Title: “when reviewing a hotel the main question i would ask is if i would stay here again, the answer would be no”
Reviews.Author: gordon75Cork
Reviews.Content: firstly on arriving at this hotel i had requested a Club Room with a double bed, when i got to the room it was a room with 2 single beds shoved together so was giving a new room, cant fault the room although a little on small side. A Club Room is supposed to have all the high end ammenities but dont expect to make a cup of tea as it has no kettle, it also doesnt have a working towel rail, found the pool area to be quite noisy with a load of kids running wild yet there is a notice saying that pool is a relaxation area. Cant fault breakfeast you can have a fry,cereal,fruit,croissants,cakes and rolls.Had a 3 course meal in hotel on 1 night for 21euro, starter was fine the main was a piece of meat and half a potato which was a joke, if i could go back again i would try somewhere else because this is supposed to be a 4 star hotel but in my mind it falls short, although cant fault the staff who where always helpful but the hotel just falls short

Reviews.Title: “Lovely, clean, pleasant staff in a quiet part of town.”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Was a lovely hotel and would def stay there again. Le rambles is at least a 40min walk. There are restaurants near the port and most look very nice. We ate in a couple of Italians and they were lovely.

Reviews.Title: “Peaceful, clean & comfortable hotel”
Reviews.Author: Tarmum
Reviews.Content: Located near Olympic Port in a peaceful area. Just 3 min walk to a lovely beach and bars. Taxi to centre of town quick and only 5-7 Euros! Didn't try the walk as with children. Tourist bus stops near by - but be warned the morning queues were dreadful - bus constantly arrived at the stop full, Recommend you walk back a stop to Port Olympic (5 mins) for an easier time. The breakfast buffet was great - lots of local and standard choices - seemed to be topped up very quickly with fresh supplies when busy. Definetly worth doing a B&B rate (also no other breakfast choice nearby). Small pool and terrace a nice extra - good for a relax/cool off after a busy day. Only one complaint - a 3 Euro charge for pool towels - spoilt an otherwise great experience (noticed post people used their room towels even though we were told it was not allowed). Would not hesitate to return

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant, clean, convenient and friendly”
Reviews.Author: pottering_pasty
Reviews.Content: Stayed on business for a conference. I had a quiet room overlooking the pool at the back of the hotel, so had a good night's sleep. Comfy, practical rooms - and very clean. Breakfast was good - plenty of choice and good quality. Had room service one night too and that was good - prompt and good quality. The hotel is not far from the beach and public transport makes it easy to get about. However, it's a bit far to walk into the main centre.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic hotel”
Reviews.Author: paulaannedon
Reviews.Content: Slightly off the beaten track. Our room was fantastic with a lovely view. Good tea making facilities. Within easy walking distance to port and felt safe at night walking back. Staff very helpful and friendly.

Reviews.Title: “A bright modern hotel which is clean and comfortable”
Reviews.Author: Satisfied031
Reviews.Content: A very pleasant hotel with helpful staff and which was near to public transport so that all areas of the city could be reached without difficulty

Reviews.Title: “This hotel grew on me”
Reviews.Author: 00runningalison
Reviews.Content: Hotel Icaria is a good 10 minute walk from the nearest Metro. Get a cab from the airport - I will do that on the way back. The staff here are all very helpful and friendly, recommending restaurants and giving directions. There are lots of good restaurants at Port Olympic which is just a few minutes walk away and I easily walked into the centre of the city, but not sure that my 66 year old mother could do the same. It is a long (but flat) walk with plenty to see on the way. This hotel does not have sea views but is close to the beach. Would I stay here again? Possibly. It is a bit far from the centre of town, the pool is outdoor and unheated so not useable at this time of year. The breakfast buffet was good but they didn't have porridge, meusli or granola or any soya milk. Still, there is plenty of food on offer and otherwise a good selection. Overall, a great place to stay if your priority (like me) is to be near the sea and within (just about) walking distance of the city. Next time I would probably look to stay at Port Vell which is both close to the beaches and close to the City Centre with more choice of bars and restaurants.

Reviews.Title: “Not the best hotelexperience I've had”
Reviews.Author: Appelgren
Reviews.Content: Our first visit to Barcelona was a nice experience if it hadn't been for the hotel. It looked OK, price was OK, breakfast more than OK but the bed seemd to be covered with some plastic under the sheet, the AC was hard to get working, the remotecontrol for lightning didn't work and - worst thing about Icaria Hotel - the rooms were not made unless we asked them to it at 5 PM on two days... The Nightclub was open on Saturday, or at least we thaught so. We will certainly not recommend this place to anyone else

Reviews.Title: “Very good hotel”
Reviews.Author: Mike_J_F
Reviews.Content: this hotel is perfect for anyone to behoest, its only ten or so minutes to one of the main hotspots in Barca, port olympic is the main strip, if you dont know where you are going the hotel will get you a taxi. The rooms are of a typical hotel style with a bed, desk mini fridges and a bathroom. We went in December and it wasnt the warmest or the coldest. The swimming pool was not in use this could be due to the fact it was December. here are computers that are free to use. Room were cleaned every day. This is a very good hotel over all and i would recommend it to anyone staying in Barca.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, shame about the staff.”
Reviews.Author: MooandJu
Reviews.Content: Our room was so hot, due to a broken climate control. That it was impossible to sleep. The following afternoon we informed reception about our problem and were told it would be fixed promptly. We waited for over an hour and a half for maintenance to come and eventually had to call down to reception to find out where the supposed maintenance person was! (This in itself was a little unusual as the only available phone was on the wall next to the toilet) Upon calling we were informed by the same curt and totally unresponsive girl that we had spoken to earlier. That the heating system had been turned off in our room. (nice of them to tell us) And that night we spent another night in an overly hot room with the heating still mal-functioning. Another thing. Why when you pay so much for your room, (especially a sweet as we had) is the breakfast extra?

Reviews.Title: “value for money”
Reviews.Author: bergfietser
Reviews.Content: Good hotel for a reasonable price. Location close to the beach, a bit outside of the centre (20 min walk) in a quiet neigbourhood. Rooms were clean and spacy, great breakfast buffet. Recommended. Booking directly on the website of the hotel is recommended because on other sites you can't include breakfast.

Reviews.Title: “Kind of pricey, but very nice and GREAT breakfast”
Reviews.Author: CJDamien
Reviews.Content: the front door glass looked like someone hit it with a bat, and the reception didnt speak great english, but they were very helpful. The pool was under construction and the Jacuzzi had freezing water in it. The breakfast was AMAZING! The restaurant didnt open until 8:00 pm, but was pretty good. Rooms were spacey.

Reviews.Title: “Interesting visit....”
Reviews.Author: love2traveltogether
Reviews.Content: My husband and I selected the Hotel Icaria Barcelona for 2 nights stay. One before our cruise and one at the end of our cruise. We took at taxi from the airport to the hotel and it cost approximately 40 euros. Upon arriving at the Hotel Icaria from our long trip to Barcelona, we were given a nice room. Though not large it is modern, mostly clean, except for a small opened bottle of nail polish remover that was left on the night stand. O.k. so we threw it away and got ready to spend what the rest of the day was left visiting the Olympic Port and having dinner. The Hotel Icaria is in a somewhat desolete area of Barcelona, however a quick walk away and you will find the Olympic Port, which is located on the beach. The Olympic Port is a great place to dine and to just walk around. The walk to and from the hotel to the Olympic Port is approximately 10-15 minutes. We had a pleasant nights sleep that night, as the bed was comfortable and we were definitely exhausted from our travels. The next morning we slept through breakfast (due to jetlag and time change) so we got up in time to get ready and catch a cab to our cruise. The cab cost approximately 15 Euros to the port. It is a very convenient location if you are spending only one night before a cruise. We then did not return to the Hotel until the end of the week. We got off the ship in the morning so we did not expect a room to be ready but they graciously did give us a room. We were in room 217. This room was larger than our last and again very nice and modern and it faced the lovely pool. We dropped our stuff off in our room and went out to enjoy the beautiful city of Barcelona. We opted to purchase tickets on the Bus Turistic and the bus stop is a block and a half away, so it too is very convenient. We spent the whole day seeing the beautiful sights that Barcelona has to offer. Upon returning to our room, we prepared for our early flight out the next day and went out to dinner. We came back early because we had to be up at 5am to catch our flight. Upon arrival back to our room, 7:30 p.m we heard a lot of noise at the pool. We hoped that by 8pm the noise would stop but it did not. We had to get some rest for our long flight home, so we chose to put on our t.v. to drown out the noise. It helped and within an hours time we were asleep. No sooner did we fall asleep that I heard someone trying to open our door. I woke my husband who jumped out of bed at the same time that a man walked in our room. He had a key and was very apologetic. He immediately left the room. I was so upset, and called the front desk to advise. They were extremely apologetic and shut off all keys to our room and brought us new ones. At that time the noise at the pool was still going on and it was now 9:30 p.m., our time to sleep was becoming less, so I inquired as to when the pool area would close and I was told that it would close by 10p.m. Once again, we put on our t.v. and tried to sleep some more. The noise did not end until very, very late and needless to say if having someone walk in your room does not make for a peaceful night, I do not know what does. In the end we got a little bit of sleep and the next morning we spoke to a lady at the front desk who was so apologetic over what happend that night. We asked for the managers name and she gave it to us. We have since contacted management and they have been nothing but accomodating and understanding. In the end, I just think that it was bad luck for us that night. I honestly believe that the Hotel Icaria is a nice hotel, nice rooms and a very nice staff. Even after all that we went through, I would still recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “ola great hotel”
Reviews.Author: frajil
Reviews.Content: This hotel was great.True it was a little way out of city but it was nice and safe. Afive minute walk to the port with restaurants.shops and casino. The staff were good and hard working. Be vigilant on la rambles first day someone tried to get in my bag.I walked around with my hand on the zip all the time.Reported the description of the pair to police saw them everyday.Must go to the hard rock cafe 15 euros for the biggest and best burger ever. went to nou camp on metro had to change easy when hotel staff told us where to go. Magical city and a lovely hotel would stay again if the breakfast was hotter it would have been perfect filled up on other things. zoo worth a visit and shops to die for.

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel if you want a quieter location”
Reviews.Author: Cfcsccc
Reviews.Content: We stayed for my sons 21st birthday celebration with a group of 6 of us. The rooms are clean and comfortable and the breakfast buffet is very good if you can get it included in your room rate. When we were there the evenings were quiet with none seeming to eat or drink at the hotel. Pool area vey good although with a full hotel it could be a bit crowded. There are 3 pc's for internet use which while they remain free are a good facility. A bit of a hike to the main town Ramblas etc but it is only a short bus ride away. The beach is only 10 mins and is very good as is Port Olympic with its eateries. Just be careful as the metro etc are full of pickpockets and we did have an incident on our arrival. All said this is an ideal hotel for a break if you prefer a base out of the centre.

Reviews.Title: “Modern, clean friendly staff - a little out of the way”
Reviews.Author: LindanPeter
Reviews.Content: The location is a little out from the centre of the city but the bus services are close,frequent and cheap. The city tour busses also pass by the front door. The rooms were clean and modern.We had one of the balcony rooms with a view of the whole city.The beach was close.We found the reception staff very helpful and friendly not so the restaurant staff although the problems are not of their making. The buffet breakfasts were Ok if you didn't want hot food as the hot food frequently wasn't hot and the coffee machines struggled to give a reasonable cup of coffee.This was probably due to the large number of guests and the low number of staff.We stayed for dinner one night, as there is no where close for a meal. There were only two waiters and a number of guests had also decided to eat in. The service was slow and the food ordinary. However this was a pleasant stay for us and we would certainly recommend the hotel with the proviso that it's a little out of the way. Hopefully the breakfasts can be improved as this is an essential requirement for anyone staying.They can always have their other meals elsewhere
