Reviews.Title: “Ideal if you want a city break/beach holiday!”
Reviews.Author: hippo35
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Icaria for 4 nights, very clean modern hotel, nice outdoor terrace area which is the only area you can smoke in although info on the web does not state it is a smoke free hotel! The hotel is a ten min walk from Port Olympic and metro, there are a few restuarants and an indoor shopping mall on the avenue but really you have to walk to the port for any life! The area does seem quite safe...saw lone females jogging on the beach promade at 10pm! The bars and restauarants on the port were quiet but id imagine in the summer months would be very busy, because of this i,d probably stay at the Icaria June to Sept when its warm enough to go to the beach etc

Reviews.Title: “Good value and good location”
Reviews.Author: JuneAZ
Reviews.Content: I spent hours looking for a hotel with a family room and the reviews on TripAdvisor led me to selecting this hotel. The front staff were very welcoming and very helpful during our stay. The first day we caught the bus in front of the hotel to Las Ramblas but trying to locate the stop to make the return journing was very difficult so we opted for the metro and this turned out to be just a few stops on the same line. The second day we spent on the beach which is just a few minutes walk away. There are also some excellent fish restaurants in the vicinity of Olympic Village. The room was somewhat small for three but it was very clean. The only thing that disappointed us was the breakfast; frankly, we thought it was pretty dreaful but overall a great experience.

Reviews.Title: “excellent hotel near port”
Reviews.Author: Yvonnehiggins
Reviews.Content: Great position. Very modern hotel, nice sized rooms. Huge bathroom. Outside pool with decking. Breakfast very good value includes spanish omlette and loads of other hot and cold foods including cheesecake and other cakes!!! Not always the hottest.... Taxi from airport approx 20mins costing 30 euros. Bus stop outside hotel and metro only 10min walk. Buy T10 ticket fro approx 8Euros allows 10 journeys on tube, bus or metro. 10min walk to the beach which is ok for near to a city swim. Excellent seafood restaurants at Port. 23euros for set menu includes wine and lobster!! Lots to see and do in barcelona, ramblas easy to get to on the bus (no14). Metro takes you to any of the famous tourist spots, gaudis familial garda, parc guell filled with gaudis sculptures etc

Reviews.Title: “excellent stay, nice decor, location and staff”
Reviews.Author: autumn007
Reviews.Content: We were pleasantly surprised. The hotel was clean with modern decor. The staff friendly and helpful. The tour bus and regular buses stopped right out front and we could walk to the beach. The lobby nice and breakfast wonderful. I am quite picky and this was definitely great especially for the price.

Reviews.Title: “Bad location...”
Reviews.Author: mustang1047
Reviews.Content: First a few good things about the hotel. The room was big and the hotel staff was great. They were really helpful with the metro, taxi's and restaurants. Here is the bad: it is a 10 minute walk to the metro, a 10 minute walk to Port Olympic and a 20-25 minute walk to town. There is nothing around the hotel. I mean NOTHING...The hotel itself was just okay. The lobby bar was bad and their "nightclub" was empty. If it rains your room will smell like rotten eggs for most of the night, they have NO wash cloths, they don't really clean your room (the never picked up any Coke cans or room service stuff from the room, and hot water for the shower was hit or miss, and the bed was very hard.. Also if you wanted a towel by the pool it cost you 3 Euros. Overall very dissappointed for the hotel. I would not stay there again. I would suggest staying closer to town. I was fooled by the "it is only a ten minute walk" it really stinks when you are walking in an empty part of town at midnight.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel - everything you need for a city break”
Reviews.Author: barnettrt85
Reviews.Content: This is a fab hotel for those on a sightseeing break or families with kids looking for a beach holiday. We were able to purchase a T - 10 multi-use train/bus/metro/tram ticket and use it on the many buses that passed right past the hotel to the main tourist spots (La Ramblas, Parc Guell, Nou Camp stadium etc). The beach was only 5 minute walk max with lovely restaurants and bars along the seafront. Great for some food and drinks at night. The hotel itself was ideal with sleek interior, free internet in the lobby (15 minutes maximum in one go), great pool. Free safety deposit box in the rooms which was easy to use. The rooms were modern with flat screen TV, good shower, air con (although the air con was a little noisy to have on at night). The only downside was that we had to ask for more pillows but these were provided almost immediately. Staff were great - we showed them where we wanted to go and they advised us on how to get there quickly and cheaply, mainly using the bus - a 1/3 of the price of the 'Bus Touristic' (which also passed by the hotel if you wish). Breakfast was a buffet which had everything to suit all tastes. Great selection, only point which could be improved was that the milk for cereal was warm and the cooked breakfast bits were sometimes cold. On the whole though, great place to return to after a day in the hustle and bustle of Barcelona, you could relax by the pool after a manic day of sightseeing.

Reviews.Title: “What more could you want”
Reviews.Author: 3saf
Reviews.Content: All staff very helpful. Close to seafront but not obviously so. Excellent rooms with good TV, including English services if wanted. Good breakfast but not very warm for the cooked range. Bed very comfortable. Lucky to be allocated a room with a terrace - no extra cost but an excellent bonus. Although METRO is some distance away - but not unacceptable - connections o all parts of Barcelona is easy. Would happily stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “modern hotel close to beach”
Reviews.Author: leahCoDown
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 2 nights to see Barcelona. Quite a good walk to center, but near to beach. Lovely modern bed rooms good size no tea or coffee facilities. Swimming pool nice and hot tub great to have a steam room and sauna. Breakfast was very nice a good choice of everything and freahly prepared. A great hotel.

Reviews.Title: “superb hotel”
Reviews.Author: dyszki
Reviews.Content: Beatiful modern rooms equipped with everything You need. Nice location, close to subway.

Reviews.Title: “Brilliant hotel can't wait for our next visit.”
Reviews.Author: LeoEdinburgh
Reviews.Content: This is our 5th visit to the beautiful city of Barcelona and we would not stay anywhere but the Hotel Icaria. The hotel is ideally positioned for a relaxing time stay only a short (10 mins.) bus ride from the centre. The hotel is bright and spacious. The bedrooms are a good size and the bathrooms have all the mod cons are bright and spotlessly clean. It's true breakfast can be busy busy but the our experience has shown that nothing is too much trouble for the lovely hard working staff. The breakfast included everything you could wish for representing very good value for money.Most days we did not bother with lunch as we were still full after b'fast. The hotel is spotlessly clean, well run and the only room for improvement might be in the area of the "Vanity Room" the cocktail lounge. It appears to be under utilised which is a shame because it is lovely. On this visit it was open twice, but once only to a small private party. The time we did use it the waiter was not at all helpful! He did not want to serve us and his opening remark was "Here's the menu many of the items are not available" Not the best welcome. We ordered a jug of Sangria at 20 euros but were told it was unavailable it was only after I caused a fuss and we threatened to walk out did the waiter suggest he could go to the other bar and order it but he could not guarantee they would serve it to us. I found this very strange and off putting particulary as we were his only customers for the whole hour we were there. Please be assured this did not in any way spoil our stay. I only mention this as I feel it is an area of the hotel that is under utilised and must be having a negative impact on the hotel's revenue? With a nicer staff this area could be a credit to the hotel. All in all you cannot go wrong in this lovely, friendly hotel: I would recommend it to everyone and we will back next year. Thank you to all the staff who helped make our visit an enjoyable experience and a special mention to the cleaning staff, who obviously take a great pride in their work.

Reviews.Title: “We loved Icaria Barcelona”
Reviews.Author: JanaDerby
Reviews.Content: We went to Barcelona for the first time to celebrate our 10th year wedding anniversary. Icaria Hotel was a great choice. It is only 5 min from lovely beaches, 5 min from the shopping centre and a 25 min. walk by the sea to the centre of Barcelona. Staff, rooms, location, all was just right. The only minus, I would say, the drinks were not cheap and yes, the light system was not perfect. We did not eat in the hotel. Barcelona has too much to offer for a good day with a very tasty meal. We thank you to the hotel Icaria for a wonderful 5 days in Barcelona. Good luck and we hope to see you all very soon.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient, Comfortable, Clean, &Quiet”
Reviews.Author: MonicafromFriends
Reviews.Content: The best thing about this hotel is the location. Just a short v. pleasant walk to the beach boardwalk where there are plenty of open air restaurants at the Olympic area and a great place to get away from the hustle and bustle of Las Ramblas. We toured the city in the daytime and were relieved to get back the the beach area and hotel in the evenings. We walked to the zoo from the hotel with a 6 yr old and it was no problem. The metro is a bit further walk in my humble opinion than some of the other reviewers had mentioned...but perhaps that is because we have a little one. Thank god we packed her scooter in a duffle bag-- we highly recommend this for families with children. We took it everywhere--the boardwalk, zoo, parks, even on the open air buses and I highly recommend this since there is usually alot of walking involved. The open air tour bus is just around the corner from the hotel and this is a good way to tour with children. The pool is small but at least there is one and it was a great way to wind down after a long day. Also, the sun beats down on the pool area pretty much all afternoon so many people were sunbathing. I tried out the "gym" once and never set foot in it again as it was much much nicer to run on the boardwalk every morning. There are only 2 treadmills and some weights I think, no cross trainers or any other equipment really. The buffet was much more than we had expected. There was a wide variety of fruit fresh sweet fruit, cold meats, hot meals, breads and muffins...pretty much anything you would want and we really filled up for our day. We left our windows cracked open at night as it felt a bit stuffy and ended up with v big mosquito bites. OUr daughter had huge welts on her face for weeks. The bathroom was spacious enough, we had no view to mention(just faced buildings) but we were on a lower floor, and the lighting system was a bit of a pain. Our daughter was asleep on one side of the room and we were unable to get just our bedside lights to stay on without lighting up the entire set of room lights---a real shame. V complicated and not efficient. Staff seemed ok but we did not deal with them very much. The computers are in the lobby but very much exposed so no privacy when writing emails. However, there is internet in every room w/out charge which is more than I can say for many hotels. It did take reception awhile to bring up extra toilet paper and blankets, but this didn't bother us much. Shower/bath could use updating but it was v clean and v good value for the we paid, esp. since it included the great buffet breakfast. We are very happy we did not stay near Las Ramblas as it was fun to visit but so much more relaxing at Icaria. BTW, best zoo we've ever been to(even better than san diego zoo, albeit smaller)--animals very alert and active, and grounds very lush and pretty.We truly enjoyed our stay. One tiny last thing, no cartoons on hotel tv in English so if your child likes a show in the morning, bring a dvd. ;) Enjoy your stay!

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel but food and some of the staff let it down.”
Reviews.Author: cg26Bath
Reviews.Content: Overall it was a good hotel in an excellent location. It is in effect a commercial hotel rather than a holiday hotel and for a 4* hotel was very reasonably priced. Our room was spacious, serviced extremely well, and was very well equiped (apart from not having tea and coffee making facilities which seemed odd for a 4* hotel). The air conditioning was brilliant, and although it was centrally controlled you just asked at reception for them to turn it up/down depending on your requirements. The location was excellent; it was in a quiet area, but the no 14 and 41 bus took you right into the Ramblas and stopped outside the hotel. The tourist bus which you could get on and off all day for €22 euros stopped just round the corner. The beach was 5 minutes walk away (up a slight hill) and there was a 'Tabac' shop just up the road that sold water papers etc. The main disadvantage was the breakfast and the kitchen staff. Although they had a brilliant choice of food they did not seem in a hurry to replace empty trays, if you asked for say a fried egg to go with your bacon you were told to come back in 5 minutes, and this happened a lot. The food was also lukewarm and not cooked very well. The dining room staff were lovely and helpful, but the kitchen staff couldn't care less. We got a deal where breakfast was included in the price, which is just as well because if we had to pay for it I would have asked from my money back. Presumably the dinners weren't great as most nights the dining room was empty and there were very few people on the terrace. Having said that I would go back again as long as I didnt have to pay for breakfast!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel, very close to the beach with fab poolside restaurant”
Reviews.Author: Travel-Diva-KD
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for a week back in September 2007 (just catching up with reviews!) and had an amazing time. We were very happy with our room and the location of the hotel was excellent if you like the beach. We went to the beach once, the rest of the time we walked the ten minutes or so to the metro stop which takes you right into the centre of Barcelona. The bus tours stopped just around the corner from the hotel, so that was also handy. We did not have breakfast included so we only had the hotel breakfast once. The poolside restaurant was excellent, serving tapas dishes like scrambled eggs & asparagus and cheese & ham croquettes, and amazing cocktails. We discovered caipirinhas here and have never looked back. We spent most of our days sight-seeing in the morning then came back in the afternoon to relax by the pool. Unfortunately, there was some building work going on at the nextdoor building, which overlooked the pool area. It was sometimes noisy, but I was very impressed that the builders never once appeared to look down at the pool area and just got on with their work (unlike what might happen in the UK!) and I felt very comfortable under the circumstances. Hopefully, the building works are all finished with by now. Really loved Barcelona - lots to see and do, weather was fab and this is the perfect base from which to make the most out of it. We would happily return to this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Good location but the attitude of the hotel staff let down the hotel”
Reviews.Author: Adam_in_the_UK
Reviews.Content: I was at a conference at this hotel and would recommend the hotel location, facilities and cleanliness for either a business trip or city break. However the hotel equipment was temperamental and the staff preferred to get on with any other tasks than help the guests, at least that was my experience. Do not try to check in before 2pm because you will not be able to!

Reviews.Title: “Good business hotel, no character but handy for beach and city, very poor customer service.”
Reviews.Author: AndK
Reviews.Content: The hotel is very much a business oriented hotel and is very well located for the beach and city. Room facilities were good. The conference area smelled of sewage. The staff were very unhelpful and even rude at times. Unless you are getting an excellent deal and are not planning on spending much time at the hotel I think you could do much better elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “Awful Hotel”
Reviews.Author: BobBestLondon
Reviews.Content: OK -the rooms were ok but that was about it. The reception was incredibly slow - kept us waiting for thirty minutes only to tell us and other colleagues that the rooms would not be ready for another couple of hours once we got to the counter - could have saved us all time by just annoucing it to everyone. We were on a conference and the food served at lunch time was positively dangerous. One of my colleagues got raw chicken in the middle and the staff were disinterested in sorting out an alternative and could not care at all. Generally all meals on the conference were warm and not hot and this caused all of us concerns when eating. Then to cap it all on the last night, for no reason at all, the barman refused to serve us. if the owners of the hotel are reading this they should have words with him - he should not be in hospitality as he basically dislikes people. He was portuguese who spoke good english as he had lived in england for 8 years but on the night in question he seemed to be suffering from some sort of misplaced aggression to us - perhaps he was happier before we arrived when the bar was empty. Other than that the hotel is in a good location and the restaurants / bar close by were great. Barcelona is a great place

Reviews.Title: “Great start to our holiday.”
Reviews.Author: llovetravelling
Reviews.Content: Stayed here prior to cruise 2 nights with family ranging from 6yrs, teenagers and disabled Mum in Wheelchair. All rooms were spotlessly clean, modern and very comfortable. Bathrooms spacious, very clean and modern. As others on review sites have stated the lift system was a pain at first. Card in, let it register, then you can select your floor. Breakfast brilliant, great choice of everything hot and cold. Tried the restaurant at hotel they offered a la carte & 3 course with coffee 25 euro menu, that was good value and we really enjoyed the dinner. Across the road and a little way down the street there is an indoor mall. Inside various eateries, including a chinese buffet, Burger King, Mexican and others. The Mexican was good. Really nice pool area, small but adequate and enough shade if needed. Great spot 5 mins walk from the beach and promenade. We had a really happy stay and would return anytime. One downside, one of the rooms had a problem with the aircon and as it was August it was rather hot, we didn't complain as we thought it wouldn't be resolved before we left and the other two rooms were fine. Being too hot after always being cold in the UK is really a joy wouldn't you agree?? Buses stop regularly almost outside the hotel and 5 mins you are in the centre of Barcelona very cheap and easy, they even have a ramp that lowers to the pavement and was brilliant to be able to get my Mum on the bus without a problem. 10 mins by taxi to cruise port cost 25 euro as we hit traffic, thousands of others heading to port at Lunchtime. Tip cheaper to prebook with A2B Taxis,

Reviews.Title: “We spent our summer vacantion here and it was great!!!”
Reviews.Author: Julya-Bella
Reviews.Content: Great location, near the beach, this hotel is perfect for visiting Barcelona, and having fun at the beach! Breakfast very good. Free Wifi Free pool access

Reviews.Title: “Find another Hotel”
Reviews.Author: ChicaTexas_USA
Reviews.Content: Recently stayed at the Icaria - we had reserved multiple non smoking rooms and upon arrival were told the only rooms available were smoking. The smell of smoke was so bad... Staff could not find one of the reservations and upon being shown a confirmation email simply shrugged! After a discussion another smoking room was available. This room was terrible - there was 1 towel no toilet paper and the shower water was cold. We thought we were just unlucky but upon speaking with other guests we learned they were having an equally bad experience. In fact they told us they did not have enough bedding in their room. The bar was closed during our entire stay for private parties and the hot tub was not hot! I will say the buffet breakfast was good with plenty of choice and the location of the hotel is great - not much around the hotel but easy walk into the city. Staff behind the desk were not great but the general staff were very good. However, I would not stay here again the rooms are just not good enough

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel, great location”
Reviews.Author: SuecWales_UK Posted by an OctopusTravel traveler
Reviews.Content: Nice rooms, lovely outside area and pool, enjoyed the buffet breakfast, plenty of choice. Staff at reception pleasant and helpful. 5 minute walk to beach and marina area, plenty of restaurants there. Buses stop right outside going into the centre of Barcelona, tourist bus round the corner - good value for money - worth doing we had 2 day pass and went on all 3 routes. Cash machine just down the road from hotel.

Reviews.Title: “lovely hotel great location”
Reviews.Author: AdrienneC4
Reviews.Content: close to the beach area and easy reach of city via public transport

Reviews.Title: “Nice”
Reviews.Author: HakanG2
Reviews.Content: Nice hotel, close to the olympic port and the shopping center La Rambla and catalunya Plaza...Room was more than sufficent and the service was satisfying:)

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel”
Reviews.Author: stevemNewcastle
Reviews.Content: The Icaria ,though about 10-15 minutes walking distance to the Ramblas, is well served by regular buses just across the road. The hotel is very clean with friendly and efficient staff and proves excellent value. We took breakfast in the dining room which was also very good. The hotel has a swimming pool and gym facilities also

Reviews.Title: “A nice, new, clean hotel”
Reviews.Author: NikolayT
Reviews.Content: A nice, new, clean hotel a block from the beach. Being a bit away from all the Las Ramblas action wasn't that bad to have a peace and quiet. At night a short taxi ride would get you back home.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel for a short break”
Reviews.Author: AMTLondon
Reviews.Content: We booked this through a package with British Airways and didn't know anythng about it. I was a bit worried when looking at some previous reviews but I found it to be an efficient, friendly hotel with all the facilities we needed. We liked the fact that it was nerar the beach, and particularly the restaurants and bars in the Olympic Port areawhich was only 5 minutes walk away. It was a quiet, safe area with a few local restaurants and bars, and a small shopping centre / cinema complex just up the road. We swere happy to walk everywhere during the day - it was about 40 minutes to Sagrada Familia, and about 30 minutes to the Rambla area. The room was a reasonable size with comfortable bed and nice furniture. The bathroom was a good size. There was a flat screen TV and wi fi access in the room. The safe was easy to operate and was big enough to take our laptop. There was a large buffet breakfast, ( which was included in our package price ) although it wasn't the highest quality. The coffee and juice weren't great but it was still extremely good value. The pool wasn't available ( it was nearly November ) but the outside area was pleasantly furnished with tables and chairs and would have been nice for my smoker husband if we had found it before we were getting ready to leave. We would be happy to go back for a couple of days but the location might be a bit boring for a longer stay. BUT BEWARE - BE VERY CAREFUL IN ANY LOCATION AS ROBBERIES ARE ENDEMIC! We were walking around near the seafront close to the Olympic Port and a young man broke away from his friends and tried to speak to us. When we didn't respond he started trying to make conversation about English football teams while trying to trip up my husband by doing some false football tackles. I would imagine if my husband had fallen over he would have helped him up and helped himself to his wallet. Fortunately he was able to swerve away with the help of some cigar smoke but it was very unnerving. Barcelona is great but always be careful and take the minimum out in your bag / wallet.

Reviews.Title: “Sleek design, attractive & clean, but only convenient for Beach”
Reviews.Author: missy176
Reviews.Content: Beautiful hotel with ample buffet breakfast. The only drawback is it was not convenient to the metro to get out of the Olympic Village area and into the other parts of Barcelona. There was a bus line near the hotel, but the trip seemed a roundabout way to get to the center of the city. Hotel charged for pool towels and would fine you if you used a room towel.

Reviews.Title: “Efficient Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Alexander028
Reviews.Content: Friendly and convenient hotel in a safe business area a few mins from beaches and restaurants. Clean and stylish. Very helpful well-trained staff. Massive help-yourself breakfasts. As a frequent business traveller - but this time with family - also noticed that it gets conference business and that's a competitive market. Free internet in lobby. Tips: note that you pay 3 Euro for a pool towel but you keep it for your stay. You must slot your key-card into lift buttoms to go up - but you must wait until door closes and is frustrating if you just arrive. Expensive mini-bar in room, but aren't they all. Shower controls in bath are hard to reach before you enter because the shower enclosure is fixed. Very expensive drinks in restaurant. Menu is international but the cooking is good. Not at all processed. Not very Spanish so also try "Mango" on the beach. There's a family Italian five mins to the right called La Vela, opposite a shopping centre and Consume supermarket. I would stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent”
Reviews.Author: ddmLondon
Reviews.Content: Spent five nights at this hotel recently and can find very little to criticize. Bed was very comfortable. room smallish, but adequate, bathroom palatial. The staff were extremely helpful and the ambience of the hotel was very pleasant. The hotel is very near the beach and a short bus ride from the main town. Very happy with this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay pre cruise/city break”
Reviews.Author: h0lidaymad
Reviews.Content: This is a very nice hotel. Close to the beach and close enough to walk/bus to city centre. It has a swimming pool and a very nice area in which to relax with a drink after a days sight seeing. Very handy for the hop on hop off open top bus which is a great way to sight see. Rooms are very comfortable and a good size. Highly recommended!

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable clean and convenient location, good value at discounted rate”
Reviews.Author: donnyman
Reviews.Content: The staff all spoke good english and gave sound advice. Service was good. The room was kept clean. Spent 8 nts there. The location on Icaria ave. is about 20 mins from the 1st stop in the Ramblas with a regular 10 min. bus service. The seafront restuarant area is some 10 mins walk away with plenty of choice and price. The hotel pool area is small and only gets the sun at certain times being enclosed by the hotel. The tce. below he pool is pleasant to sit in with drinks and snacks available. Breakfast buffet is OK but not great. Had my pocket picked while walking on promenade 1st night, my own fault was aware of problem as stated in guide books, he only took cash and threw wallet back when I chased after him. On last day walked away from 2 men on Icaria ave. who were trying plant and policeman scam, the supposed policeman didnt try and stop me and my wife leaving.

Reviews.Title: “First Class Hotel in the Port area of Barcelona”
Reviews.Author: LeoEdinburgh
Reviews.Content: This is the 4th time we have stayed at this hotel and it only gets better. Not in the centre of town, not trying to be anything it isn't. This hotel and it's staff are great. It's about a 40 min walk to the Rmablas or 10 min on the no 14 bus. Buses run every 10 min and stop right outside the hotel. This hotel is a gem of a find, has everything you need for a trip to Barcelona and you will discover the Port area too. Hotel spotless, reasonably priced and the breakfasts are amazing and included in the cost if you book 30 days in advance. My thanks to the staff for all their hard work and we'll be back next year.

Reviews.Title: “Very Good Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Cotard
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for a week in June with a friend, and the Hotel Icaria was the perfect choice. It's out of the way enough to be a quiet, peaceful and relaxing place, while also being very accessible to the city centre by public transport, or even by foot. As an avid walker, I'd easily walk into the city centre from the hotel most days, but it would probably take about 20 minutes I guess. There is a Metro stop just a few blocks from the hotel, however, and I believe there is a bus-stop even closer, though I never took the bus. I must say that the public transport, particularly the Metro, is superb in Barcelona and gets you to pretty much anywhere within a few minutes. The hotel is also quite close to a number of beaches, and the Port Olympic village. We didn't have breakfast or eat in the restaurant so can't comment on that, but we did order in room-service a couple of times and it was grand. Arrived pretty late at night to the hotel but check-in was very quick and room was ready, as booked. The room was kept very clean throughout the duration of our stay. The front-desk staff were multi-lingual, and spoke English to us. We didn't make many requests of the staff but any interaction we did have with them we found them to be friendly and helpful. I found the bed to be very comfortable, and air-conditioning was unobtrusive and just right (ie, not too noisy or too cold). The room was spacious enough and the bathroom was quite fancy. There was free Wi-Fi in the room which was very handy. The room was good overall. This is the perfect choice of hotel for those who want to explore Barcelona but might want to avoid staying in the nightlife hub of the city. It's a peaceful area, and I thoroughly enjoyed my stay at the Icaria. - Cotard

Reviews.Title: “Very disapointed”
Reviews.Author: VavaBaguette
Reviews.Content: Hotel Icaria is an ok hotel though the staff of the hotel was very unhelpful. Me and my boyfriend stayed at Icaria for two weeks and after a few days one of my dresses was missing from our room. I contacted the staff about it and they did nothing to help me. All they said was 'come back tomorrow' over and over again. I even spoke to the manager himself who was very unpleasant and did nothing to help me. The day before our checkout I told them I could not wait any longer since we were going home the day after but all they said was that they couldnt do anything to help me. No help from them whatsoever. Very disaponting. I know it was just a dress, but when Im staying at a hotel I want to be able to leave my stuff in the room without anyone taking it. Anyway over all the hotel was ok. Nice breakfast. Rooms are ok. I would not rate this hotel as a 4-star though. It is more like a 3-star.

Reviews.Title: “shoddy icaria”
Reviews.Author: miana01
Reviews.Content: Disapponting after staying there for 2 nights. Appalling services we received. Lying on the sun loungers tried ordering drinks you would not get hold of any staff within 20meters. They say you can only drink at the terrace when some sipping their jugs of cocktails beside the pool. They do have a jaccuzzi but I'd call it a very cold children's padding pool, mini bar not fully stocked up, no shower gel unless requested, no dressing gowns, no slippers, and don't expect a hot cup of tea there are no tea bags in the room.. Would definitely not call it a 4 star hotel

Reviews.Title: “Would recommend!”
Reviews.Author: MrsSS01
Reviews.Content: very helpful staff - made a restaurant reservation for us (try Los caracoles just off the Ramblas!), good size, clean rooms, great pool, breakfast served till 11am which was lovely. Good security too - you cant go up in the lift without a key card. No traffic noise at night Not far from bus stop (staff very helpful with tourist info)

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel- not a great location though!”
Reviews.Author: KP58
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 3 nights on business and then over the weekend as my husband joined me. The hotel is fabulous- extremely helpful reception staff, spacious rooms, good breakfast which is served till 11am but it's just not where you want to be to explore beautiful Barcelona. The closest metro is a 15-minute walk away - there's a bus stop round the corner though but the routes weren't straightforward to figure out and only took you to Plaza Catalunya. Its location makes it limited to choosing where to eat as there's no where decent closeby. Having said that it was a great chance to walk to Barcelonetta (25 minute walk) along the beach- don't think we'd have gone there if were were closer to the centre. This hotel would be perfect if the metro was a bit closer!

Reviews.Title: “Brilliant Hotel... Could Not Fault It!”
Reviews.Author: TravelAgentReview
Reviews.Content: Stayed in this hotel for one night on 29th April for a pre-cruise stay in Barcelona. Me and my friend have never been to Barcelona before and we got a brilliant deal on this hotel so thought how bad could it be? It was actually a brilliant hotel. Reception staff were lovely, calling a taxi for you when you needed one and check in was a breeze. Room was lovely, very modern complete with plasma tv (although no English channels) and very clean. Safe in room was easy to work and there is an ice machine on every floor so u can fill your ice bucket in your room up without having to call someone. It was a scorching day when we arrived so we went out to sunbathe, pool deck is gorgeous, all wood with sunbeds and a few umbrellas. Lovely pool and jacuzzi. Small gym and spa for whoever wants it. Lovely outdoor patio area with sofas to chill out and some tables and chairs where u can eat your lunch outside. We did eat lunch in the hotel, not a lot on the menu but enough for a light snack. Drinks were quite expensive but thats the case in hotels everywhere. A little bit out of the centre but only approx 7 euros from Catalunya square. We got the bus from the airport to Catalunya square which was 4,25 euro each way. Catalunya square is at the top of La Rambla so its handy being central to it. I work as a travel agent and I was very impressed with this hotel. If ur maybe staying for a longer duration then maybe something a bit more central but this hotel is perfect as its not to close to everything (we met another couple who had paid a lot of money to stay on La Rambla but they moved to the Icaria after they had a sleepless night due to the noise) I would def recommend this hotel to anyone who is considering a night or two in Barcelona.

Reviews.Title: “Very good Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Casian
Reviews.Content: No problem at all. Very pleasant hotel, near by public transportation stations, good staff, good breakfast, nice and clean area. I would reccomend it to anyone that wants to have a good holiday in Barcelona. For us the quality of the hotel contributed a lot to the very good impression that he have left with. Congratulations !

Reviews.Title: “Good position, good hotel. Not so good fitness/spa area”
Reviews.Author: leo_ant
Reviews.Content: The hotel was exactly what we expected. Nice position far from noise and crowd, close to see shore. Not too far from Metro stop (600 m. routhly), but 3 buses stop in front of the hotel, each with daily schedule every 10-15 minutes. Staff spoke good English. The only remark is about fitness and souna, which is outside for access, cold for undressing (no heating in a common space), and both sauna and turkish bath were just warm when working, so really unusably at all. So, dont' choose this hotel for the relaxation/spa, but for the rest it is ok.

Reviews.Title: “cold rooms and cold staff”
Reviews.Author: djstu77
Reviews.Content: Stayed one night in march. Check in was quick and the rooms seemed nice. Even tho it was hot outside it soon became clear that our room was not. The room was freezing cold and it didnt help that I had a bad cold. I asked the reception about any heating and explained my sitiuation and was met with a NO, that was it. The only way to get warm was to have a shower but that just created a lake on the floor and with no fan there was a very damp smell. Friends in another room had a kettle and tea making items but we had none. There was also the previous guests comment card which echoed what I have said about the room. The location was good for the port and the beach but that ws it. I would not stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely Hotel, Clean, Friendly Staff just a tad out of the way”
Reviews.Author: bexxxx
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hotel Icaria for a week in March 2009 and found it a lovely hotel. The staff are very friendly and helpful and the rooms spacious, clean and modern. The location is about a ten minute walk from the beach and has shops and bars about a 1 minute walk away. The restraunts and bars in the area are extremely expensive, the cheapest places closting upwards of $30 each per meal exc drinks which are around 4 - 5 euros and higher for a lager/beer. The hotel bar seemed cheaper and that seemed expensive until we ventured out. Id advise if you arent taking anything out of the mini bar to have them empty it as things went missing out of ours, although we told the staff and they didnt ask for payment of the items so i assume they are aware the cleaners must have a dabble. To get there from the airport, take the blue bus outside the airport arrivals to the centre of catalunya then a furthur bus i think it was the 42 which drops you directly outside the hotel. A taxi from the Ramblas costs around 1 euros to and from the hotel. I stress when walking around the Ramblas do NOT walk down the alleys at night, we di having heard about pick pockets and just thought we'd be careful but its organised gangs of in excess of 20 men following you trying to get you alone to rob you....very very scary. The area of the hotel however is in a nice quiet place and feels very safe walking around at night. Overall a great experiance and if we ever went back to Barcelona wouldnt hesitate to stay there. For good deals go to booking.com

Reviews.Title: “Great value, quiet place”
Reviews.Author: sanjinv
Reviews.Content: The stay was great, I can only cite user adt52's comment: "The Hotel Icaria is a fantastic place. The staff were very friendly and helpful and the breakfast which was included in our cost was second to none." The room was nice and clean, very comfortable - though some might be a little annoyed by the technology (hint: the key-cards). Location is quiet, near to the beach and Port Olimpic, bus stops for lines 14 & 41 that take you to the centre (Monument Colom, Placa Catalunya...) and 92 (to the Park Guell)are in front of the hotel, and a shopping mall is some 100 m away. Taxis are all around and relatively cheap, metro works really great. From the airport (besides a taxi of course) you can take the "Aerobus" to the Placa Catalunya (4 EUR per person) and from there bus 41 across the street (or 14 that stops in famous La Rambla some 100 m further), but the Renfe train line from the airport to Estacio de Franca would be the best solution as you can use a single ticket for the ride (unfortunately, at the time of our visit this line was not accesible). Check the Bus turistic lines as they seem a good option (not personally tested), one of the lines stops near hotel - othervise take advantage of the cheap T-10 bus/metro/Renfe/tram ticket. And of course, prepare yourself by searching the 'Net for all the info you can absorb before you embark! :-)

Reviews.Title: “Worth a Visit”
Reviews.Author: adt52
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a visit to Barcelona. Not sure that the last week in October was a good time to visit Spain and get good weather, however we were not disappointed 4 beautifully warm and cloudless days out of 7 wasn't bad. The Hotel Icaria is a fantastic place. The staff were very friendly and helpful and the breakfast which was included in our cost was second to none. Full English or Continental and as much as you wanted. Our room was a triple and was well appointed although the air conditioning seemed to have a mind of it's own. Having wireless internet in the room was also an advantage. The hotel was spotlessly clean and although there were conferences taking place in the hotel while we were there, the relaxing atmosphere within the public areas of the hotel for non conference guests was not disturbed. It was a shame that I wasn't able to speak to the hotel Manager to offer my compliments before we left to return home.

Reviews.Title: “Quiet locaton, close to the beach...”
Reviews.Author: Indiragold
Reviews.Content: We had a 4 night stay at this hotel which was overall ok. I realized this was more to do with the fact that we didn't have to encounter the staff who seemed to want to help but a bit confused when a problem was raised by another guest. We had one minor problem, I say minor because we left the next day but our bathroom ceiling all of a sudden started dripping water quite fast, I called the reception who assured me they were sending someone but never did, we mopped up the water with towels. The leak stopped, I assume because the person above finished their shower and we left the next day. The lifts are a bit of an experience. You have to put your room card in the slot to go up - not down, but they fail to tell you this. My cards kept getting demagnetised for some reason over the course of our stay and I repeatedly traveled up and down in the lifts until fellow guests saved me. Amusing at first but very tedious after my tenth trip... Some other guests had problems with their room bookings in not receiving what they had requested, they seemed to have alot of hassle trying to find the right person to sort it out and were waiting in the pool area for a good few hours. The room was quite small I found for a 4 star, but it was clean and the bathroom with it's green marble is pleasant. There's no balcony however, a problem if you smoke and want a glass of wine in your room, but the lounge area to the left of the pool is lovely. Simple, but very comfortable, with deep, wooden sofas and if you're there early, you can loiter there the whole day ordering light snacks and drinks. I loved breakfast and am not sure why previous guests have been disappointed. There's a huge spread, something for everyone I thought and they even provided Soya milk much to the delight of my friend! The hotel is a short trot from the beach. It's in a quiet location and is easily accessible by bus. We tried to take a bus from the airport when we arrived but there was major confusion when we got to Catalunya bus depot. The tourist information queue snakes round and you'll be in it for half an hour at least. Many places were closed for 'the holidays' , which annoyed me as it's a holiday destination. By all means take your vacation, but staff your shops in the meantime! La Ramblas is a very busy street with stalls and entertainers as you see in Covent Garden. Watch your bag/wallet, there's alot of silver/ethnic/gothic/I made it myself jewelry and fridge magnets on sale on nearly every stall which is great, if you like that sort of thing - I don't. If you want nightlife, then this is not necessarily a good place to stay. The buses stop running after 10.30pm I think and the local bars/clubs are uneventful. It's also quite lonely walking back from the beach bars area to the hotel so take care... Go and see the Gaudi architecture, but go early otherwise you'll be standing in Madame Tussuad's queues, uncomfortable in the August heat! Note that if your speak a little Spanish, in this region the Catalan dialect is spoken! This hotel is fine for a short break but if i go again then I'll stay somewhere more central...

Reviews.Title: “Loved Barcelona”
Reviews.Author: mello10
Reviews.Content: just returned from a 4 day stay at the 4 star ICARIA hotel in barcelona and a really great time we had. the hotel was on a quiet and safer part of barcelona yet 5min walk and you where on the beach. also near port olympia with its bars and restaurants these i would not recommend but if you enjoy tapas and piella you will love it the hotel was spotless rooms cleaned every day the staff where nice and helpfull breakfast good out side the hotel doors their is a bus stop number 41 every 10 min and this takes you into the heart of the old gothic quater and las rambles the shops are amazing also port vell marina where you will find a irish pub with great food at very good prices any one going to barcelona i would recommend ths hotel for having the quietness and also the confience of the shops. If you have shoped to you drop then get a taxi their is plenty of them for the price of 4euro 50 enjoy

Reviews.Title: “not great......”
Reviews.Author: LondonLisa_C
Reviews.Content: We picked the hotel as we wanted to be near the beach but not too far away from the centre of things as we were staying for 5 nights. The location was fine, the beach and port (with all it's bars and restaurants) just a 5 minute walk away, but other than that the hotel was really isolated - but at least it was quiet at night. Check in was short and sweet, but they forget to tell everyone that you need to use your hotel key card in the lift or you won't be going anywhere..... luckily some other guests helped us out. The room was ok, but the bathroom door didn't shut, it took a few hours and phone calls to resolve but as the hotel was full and we couldn't change rooms, they did send someone to fix it pretty quickly. We had to go down and spend a couple of hours by the crowded pool area while we waited (it's VERY small, even smaller than the pictures on the websites so don't expect to get a sun lounger). Otherwise the room was ok & fittings new, just don't look too closely and so you don't notice the bathroom ceiling had a damp patch and the bedside cabinet tops weren't properly clean.... they do provide tea and coffee, but no milk and the plastic tea spoons disappeared after day 1.... be prepared to bring your own!! On the 3rd day there was a problem with a burst pipe so we had no water for a day - we called to complain and reception explained no one had water (hadn't had it all day, not that they bothered to tell anyone) and then brought us one 1litre bottle of mineral water to wash with (between the two of us). When the water came back on it was slightly yellow, so we decided not to use it. Breakfast was very mediocre (hot food limited and cold) - ok I think pretty atrocious for a 4 star hotel (coffee tasted like watery instant, and only herbal tea as an alternative) - & the rest was disappointing, suggest you head to the local shops or the port for a much better option (and cheaper!) So, to the main complaint, after day 1 we decided to cancel breakfast which we had pre-booked for one of us - and were told by an incredibly rude man at reception (he kept answering the phone without a single apology while talking to us), who told us we couldn't, it was included in the price (no it wasn't) and only when we got annoyed would he check our reservation and realise that we had ordered the breakfast separately and yes it could be cancelled. Reception in general were rude and unhelpful, not interested in helping or providing good service. We asked about the theatre tickets (as per the leaflet in reception) and they told us to go to the theatre ourselves and buy tickets..... the one notable exception was the very nice lady who helped us check out very quickly and ordered a taxi as our flight had changed, she was quick and efficient. The hotel is just about ok, although I think VERY expensive for what you get, I think you are better off paying a bit more for the hotels nearer the port/town - they are also that bit nearer to things as it's about 30 min walk to the old town from the hotel icaria -or picking something more reasonably priced nearer town - the public transport system is fantastic & cheap (don't go on the tourist bus, get on the metro/use taxis - it actually worked out much cheaper and far more flexible) Barcelona however is fantastic, worth the trip, but probably you should pick another hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Good Location”
Reviews.Author: uktravelller
Reviews.Content: The staff on reception were helpful and polite, room was modern and clean, our room had a view of the pool and terrace, and a view of the city. Bar area was nice and relaxing on the terrace plenty of seats. Breakfast had a varied choice, but not so lucky the second morning, no cooked food, one of the coffee machines did'nt work and the othe one had run out of hot water. You also have to time going to breakfast at the right time, the hotel was full when we stayed, which meant that at one point there were no tables available, maybe we were just unlucky that day. Location of the hotel is good, its a 10 min walk to the nearest metro, and about the same time to the beach/marina area. In all had a good stay, would go back to the hotel and recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Positive overall”
Reviews.Author: GMACz
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Icaria for a week in mid August, a family of five. On the positive, check in was fine & we found the staff generally friendly & helpful. Rooms were roomy & modern, a feature of the whole hotel & everything was generally clean. Breakfast was fine although cooked items tended to be cold. Other food provided was mostly good. The terrace area & pool were excellent & service quite good. There's a nice hot tub next to the smallish pool & constant steam room & sauna in the back areas. Location was good if you want to be near the beach & there's a decent choice of restaurants all within 10 mins walk. Taxis are cheap & only 6/7 Euros into town. Internet access was very good. On the downside, no porter, you have to lug your own stuff around which was a pain. Coffe/tea making facilities were advertised but no tea/coffee provided & requests met with blank expressions. Luggage is stored in an area next to reception - not particularly safe & I noticed this was the same with all guests luggage. Major hassle was the keycard system, room cards were needed for the lift & along with almost every guest I spoke to it worked only half the time sending us all over the place. Health & safety check is required on the fire escape/stair doors, floors 1 & 2 were sticking & would be dangerous in an emergency. All the family enjoyed the stay & we'd probably use the Icaria again.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice”
Reviews.Author: joanna_c_c
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a weeks stay at the icaria. Loved the hyotel...modern, clean, well priced and good facilities. Have read some of the other reviewers comments and do not agree that staff are rude... i did overhear a few grumpy guests at the front desk but I would say the way they were treating the hotel staff was rude and obnoxious (in english) rather than the other way round. Either way we had no problems and found them to be helpful with any of our queries. Rooms good size, cleaned daily, and coffee etc replenished. We went for a beach relaxing holiday so it was ideal as literally a 5min walk to icaria beach. Metro stop is a 10 min walk. Very nice breakfast - all continually re stocked throughout the breakfast time slot. Pool area small but perfectly formed! Would choose this hotel again if we revisit barcelona.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel”
Reviews.Author: CarolinaJuez
Reviews.Content: Very good hotel. Near a nice beach. The turistic bus, stops 2 blocks from the hotel and the subway is 5 blocks away. Nice and clean rooms. Quite neighborhood.

Reviews.Title: “Not quite what I was expecting”
Reviews.Author: 1_to_travel_on
Reviews.Content: It was fine for a one night stay before our cruise, but I can't bring myself to say it was above average. A quick rundown: Check in went smoothly and we were able to get our room around 1:00. The front desk staff somewhat answered our questions, but weren't overly helpful. It was a brisk 15-20 minute walk to the Metro, but the bus stop is fairly close. There were 4 of us, so we got the metro multi pass and shared it for our one day which worked out great. Breakfast was fine, but not $25 worth. Could not sleep because the room was so warm. The a/c was making a noise, but nothing cool was coming out. Unfortunately, it was raining, so we were not able to open the window for fresh air either. We asked the hotel to hold our luggage after we checked out. They have a locked room, but because they were busy, we were told to set it aside in the lobby and they would get to it when they had a chance. When we returned several hours later, I was disappointed to see it still sitting in the lobby were we left it. We saw notes that this was an up and coming neighborhood, not sure about that, it was quiet though and a good location for our port departure the next day. On that note, definitly watch out for the cab drivers. We were told by the hotel that the ride would be 20-25 euro, the cab meter said 18 when we arrived at the terminal, then he did some magic and suddenly it was 30 euro. We questioned him and he said it was because of our luggage. Not in the mood to argue, we paid it, but I wish we had been more firm. Heck, we were already where we wanted to be so what could he really do if we had refused to pay that amount.

Reviews.Title: “Just about ok”
Reviews.Author: ElaineCat
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Icaria during the F1 of Barcelona. I would say that the hotel was just about ok. I checked in on Friday afternoon, stayed at the pool for about 2 hours (you have to pay extra for pool towels) not on for a 4 star hotel, especially when you see all other guests with room towels. Anyway the cost of the room was €290 a night (corporate rate) in the three nights we stayed the sheets were never changed, no soap was put into the rooms, had to call housekeeping. Worse the rooms were done utill 17.00pm in the faternoon so if you do want to go back to the room for a while impossible. Having said this breakfast was ok even if we did have to pay €16 extra ahead.... Not close to the city ctr need Taxi, but very close to Barcelonetta, which, for who knows the area is good for going out in the evening.

Reviews.Title: “Quiet rooms at the back!”
Reviews.Author: Travelling_Light65
Reviews.Content: This is a very modern hotel with clean minimalistic rooms. Good firm beds, laminate floors, clean dark green marble bathrooms and the best power shower I have experienced! On arrival we were offered a suite at the front of the building but after one night found it too noisy from the traffic on Avinguda d'Icaria and so asked for a quieter room. We were given a room, albeit smaller at the back of the hotel overlooking the swimming pool. 6th flloor and great view of Montjuic in the distance and a building site in the foreground but the room was lovely and quiet and so a small sacrifice to pay. If you are going to stay in April then note there is no air conditioning until May. We found it slightly stuffy as a result. I read on the Venere web site that this hotel is two minutes from the metro. Beware, it is not! The nearest stop is Ciutadella Vila Olimpica and it takes a good 15 minutes to walk to. However there is a bus stop outside the hotel and No 14 goes up La Rambla while No 41 goes a more direct route to Placa de Catalunya. Get the 10 trip card, valid on the bus and the Metro - good value as it will save you money on individual tickets and so much more convenient. Hope this helps with your hotel selection in Barcelona. Enjoy your trip.

Reviews.Title: “Second visit!”
Reviews.Author: MarkA74
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hotel Icaria in June of 2007. It was the second time I had stayed there (the first was a business trip in 2006), but the first time that I had taken my partner there. The staff are very friendly & even though I tried my (admittedly ropey) Spanish upon arrival, they immediately replied in excellent English! The rooms were excellently presented and my partner was very impressed with the overall quality of the hotel. Hotel Icaria is five minutes walk from a "crossover point" for the "Barcelona Bus Turistic" (the red / blue / yellow open topped hop-on / hop-off sight seeing buses), basically you walk out of the reception and go left (towards the car wash at the end of the road) and then turn right (the stop is across the road). You can buy a two day ticket on board the bus for 24 euros and we used this service to get around the whole of Barcelona during our stay. It's excellent value! As for the hotel's other amenities, the bar & restaurent are very good (although not that cheap) and the pool is fine (although being so close to the Olympic Marina & beach we didn't actually use the pool.) I would recommend this hotel unreservedly, it is great value for money, it's close to the beach and marina, has good public transport links and the rooms are excellent. Our flight wasn't until after 22:00, but we were able to leave our cases in a secure room behind reception whilst we went off having a final days exploring before heading back to pick up the cases and get a taxi to the airport with no problems at all. One tip I would give, don't take a taxi from the airport, get the blue bus from outside arrivals which goes to Placa de Catalunya, then pick up the Barcelona Bus Turistic on the Blue Line & then it drops you off minutes walk from the front door of the hotel! I'm looking forward to going back again!

Reviews.Title: “It's simply all you could ask for”
Reviews.Author: dd123Uk
Reviews.Content: I promised Marc Camps (The Manager) of the hotel I would write a review on Trip Advisor, and here I am. Im generally easily pleased anyway, but can say almost with complete certainty that you will not regret booking at this hotel. Yes it's in a quiet not in the heart of it location & a 30 min walk to The Ramblas (Dont know what the big deal is about this strip personally, sure it's worth a look but it's just the tourist "Oxford street " of Barcelona!) There is so much to see & things to do & sample that you might wish to venture further away from this area & enjoy some Tapas for 7 Euro in a bar full of locals, there are many! Travel is easy with the T10 ticket that has been mentioned gets you back to the airport too-Its really worthwhile for about £5 Anyway, for a balanced view the hotel has a slight business feel to it, not that I mind that.But for those that want a "local run" hotel may want to bear this in mind. I had a suite by the way, but I am sure the standard rooms are just a smaller version anyway. Book it- you cannot fail to appreciate this hotel does exactly what a modern hotel should. Darren

Reviews.Title: “Good value - pool, on bus tour routes, on outskirts”
Reviews.Author: gillygeegee
Reviews.Content: This is a good, clean, quite, hotel with a pool and good sized rooms (our room had a massive bathroom which was about the same size as the room space). Flat screen TV in room with reasonable channel selection. Internet access in the lobby. It is about 2kms from Sagrada Familia (which we could see lit up at night from our upper floor room, overlooking the pool) and La Rambla so about a 20 to 30 minute walk depending on your pace. It is less than 5 minutes from the beach which, when we visited in April was quiet. The hotel is located in a residential area so there are not a lot of facilities for the tourist nearby in terms of restaurants, although there appeared to be lots of cafes and sandwich shops around for day time use. There is also a small shopping centre nearby (a block away) where there is a supermarket to buy supplies. The hotel is also situated very close to the cross section between two of three hop and hop off open top open top bus top tours (with one of the companies) which is useful if you like that kind of thing. We did eat in the hotel restaurant which was fine and good, if standard grub. The buffet breakfast was good, varied and plentiful. Overall, although the location means you do have a reasonable walk to many things it is peaceful and of good quality.

Reviews.Title: “Our Stay At The Icaria-”
Reviews.Author: LINDIE3
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Icaria for 4 nights at the beginning of November and had a wonderful time there. It is quite a distance from La Rambla and many of the restaurants but everywhere is easily accessible once you find your bearings. We have no complaints about the hotel but I would suggest trying to include breakfast in the price when booking as it is very expensive if you don,t want a big breakfast. Overall Barcelona is a wonderful place and I would definitely go again as there isn't enough time to see every thing. The taxi from airport cost us 28 euros going and 25 going back, so I think everyone must get charged different prices. I would probably use public transport if we go again now that we have been. couple from Newcastle

Reviews.Title: “Elegant, clean and spacious”
Reviews.Author: Michnield
Reviews.Content: My husband and I visited Barcelona and booked the Icaria through Hotel Connexions. I was worried that it would be a bit 'out of the way' but as we like to use public transport, we found the hotel after a 15 minute train journey to Passeig de Gracia with a change to the yellow metro line taking us the 4 stops to Ciutadella Vila Olimpica. It was still a 10 minute walk from there but once we found the hotel, we felt comfortable with our choice! Although we were quite early, we were offered a twin room which was ready or the keys to view it to help us decide, or we could wait for the double room we had booked. The receptionist rightly said that the twins were slightly larger and we were glad that we decided to take the twin room. We never had to queue for the reception as there was always plenty of staff on duty, especially booking out time! Food is available all day with some options available all night as well. Breakfast was included in our room rate which we were glad about because quite a few people seemed surprised at breakfast that breakfast wasn't included in their rate and it was an extra 15 Euros each. You can eat 'bar snack' type meals which are reasonable or opt for the restaurant meals. Breakfast was ok for a Spanish hotel with plenty of fresh fruit and pastries, not much choice of cereal and no chance of a decent cup of tea!!! We enjoyed our stay, found the staff very helpful and able to speak good English, comfy beds, good bathrooms....we would love to go there again!

Reviews.Title: “still good”
Reviews.Author: elestoban
Reviews.Content: have previously reviewed this hotel - this time i took a group of 16 guys & they were all very pleased. met a group of 8 women who also seemed very pleased with the amenities. large twin rooms work well for sharing. nice spacious bathrooms - be careful with shower - has mind of its own! there is no question that the outside seating areas work really well for groups. service is friendly & quick although sorting out who ordered what / when can be a bit chaotic therefore best to pay or sighn as u go. breakfast is still good but a bit of a bun fight - it goes until 11.00 but they start clearing away at 11.00 on the dot. one big recomend was the restaurant El Asador de aranda at Tibidabo - about 12 euros by taxi - great for group in private room or just dinner for 2 nb meat eaters only !

Reviews.Title: “Close to the beach!”
Reviews.Author: 14traveling
Reviews.Content: This was a great place to stay! Everyone was friendly, it was very modern, the room was very large even by American standards, the beds were comfy, and they do have a great breakfast but it is expensive. The front desk staff was very kind. My husband had a work emergency and his cell had died, the front desk let him make a call overseas for free. The pool area was great and it was only 2 blocks from the beach! I was a little scared to stay there because of some of the reviews but we cancelled our other hotel reservations to stay there because we liked it so much. The bus is right out front and it takes you right to the metro. I would recommend this hotel to anyone!

Reviews.Title: “Just as expected”
Reviews.Author: carlw1968
Reviews.Content: On arrival parked the hire car in the underground garage, just press the buzzer and reception will let you in. There is a lift to all floors and reception is located on the PB, don't know what it stands for. Room was ok and everything worked as it should, asked for extra pillows, delivered within 30 minutes. Not a lot of room by the pool and sun loungers are few but free to use, hotel will provide towels at 3 euro's each for use by the pool, do not take towels from the rooms. Breakfast was the only disappointment as the staff seemed unable to keep up with either food, plates, cups or coffee, there always seemed to be something missing even though we tried early (9 am) and later (10:40 am) times to see if it made any change.....it didn't. TV in the room is limited to 1 news channel in English (CNN) but most programs are in Spanish or the local Catalan dialect. We didn't stay to watch tv anyway! Hotel is located in the Olimpic Port area and is on 2 tourist bus routes so easy to get in to town as the Blue route stops in the central Square at the top end of La rambla where all the action is. Overall? ok but don't bother with the breakfast at 14 euros a go it is better to check out the cafe's locally or miss it and have a early lunch. hope this helps in your choice, we would go again?, yes because it is in a good location and is clean, staff a bit so so but this seems to be the norm for most hotels here, Enjoy

Reviews.Title: “Great service and accommodations”
Reviews.Author: Kathi_Expander
Reviews.Content: First of all the location is fabulous. It is a 5 minute walk to the beach with many great restaurants, 10 minutes to the city business section and about a 30 minute walk to the end of La Rambla. The Bus Touristic has a stop right around the corner from the hotel. When making our reservations with Travelocity I had a "triple room." For some reason I thought it was 2 rooms with a bathroom. I was wrong. Instead, I was given a one room with a king size bed and a small twin and the bath. I went to the front desk and they pulled my order. I told them what I thought I had ordered and they said, "You have 2 adults and a child." I explained that the child was 17. They immediately checked and upgraded me, at no cost, to a business suite that had a room with a king bed and an "office" equipped with computer, desk, recliner chair, and coffee table, with plenty of room for a single bed. It was perfect. The bathroom was awesome. We were staying there for 3 days and traveling elsewhere for 2 weeks and returning at the end of our trip. The front desk reserved that same room for us on our return trip at no additional cost. The all-you-can-eat breakfast was great with all varieties of breakfasts from around the world. It was definitely enough to hold us over until Tapas time, with a gelato and espresso lunch in between. The staff was wonderful and accommodating. I give it 5 stars and will tell everyone to go there. By the way, the taxi from the airport was only 18 Euros, plus 1 Euro for each piece of luggage. I am not sure what the other person is talking about when they paid 38 Euros. Also, there is a train from the BCN airport to Estacio de Francia, and the cab from that station to the hotel is only 6 Euros plus 1 Euro for each piece of luggage. This hotel and it's staff is a real winner.

Reviews.Title: “decent hotel for the price”
Reviews.Author: mlomagno
Reviews.Content: Booked this hotel for one night when we stopped over in Barcelona. We've been to several hotels in this city and overall this was a pleasant hotel. Hotel is a few short blocks from the beach. Public Transport is also several blocks away but not too far. Hotel room was clean and roomy. One problem. Bathroom sink glass vanity which was attached to wall was falling off. Looks like they are not big on repairing. Noticed several things in room that needed touching up. This seems to be a recurring problem with these hotels. They put them up in lightening speed and tend to have contractors who cut corners or workmanship is not up to par. Regardless, hotel is recommended if you do not care about being in the center of the city, wish to spend less but not compromise on quality. By the way, I decided to book here based on the many reviews on here. They were pretty accurate. Thanks to them!

Reviews.Title: “A good hotel near the beach”
Reviews.Author: patsyc216
Reviews.Content: I base all my hotel choices on the reviews and ratings on tripadvisor and usually only book hotels that are ranked within the top 20. I don't know why I decided to go against this norm and booked the Icaria but I have no regrets whatsoever! Location: We took the train from the airport and changed to the L4 on the metro at Passeig de Gracia. You can use T10 tickets for the train as well as the metro. The walk from the metro station to the hotel is at least 10 minutes. But since one of us almost had his wallet pickpocketed, that was the last time we took the metro during this trip. Going back to the airport at the end of our trip we took a taxi and it only cost EUR23. The hotel is set in a quiet area with a bus stop right in front of it and the tourist bus is only around the corner. You can get to La Rambla on the 14 bus in about 10-15 minutes but a taxi ride will only cost EUR6 anyway. A 5 minutes walk will take you to the beach and a further 2 minutes you're at the marina. There's a good supermarket in the shopping center only 2 minutes away where there are also lots of restaurants. Hotel / reception: It has a nice lobby, well furnished with tropical fish tanks. As soon as you enter the hotel you can already see the terrace and the pool in the back. Apparently some non-guests also wander in to use the pool... People at reception are helpful. They sit quietly behind the desk but as soon as you walk up to them they will smile and do what they can for you. Check in was quick but one of our rooms wasn't ready until about 2 hours after we checked in. Room: Sufficient space, well furnished and clean. The bed was very comfortable. I've been having back pains for a few weeks before the trip and during the 3 nights there I always woke up the next morning pain free! (Once I got home to UK the pain returned... :P) The safe and fridge both came in very useful. We had a pool view room on the 4th floor and we could see the AGBAR tower clearly. No noise from the construction site next door while we were there. Maybe they have August off... Breakfast: A good selection of hot and cold items. Breakfast is served from 7 - 11 so it never got too crowded. Recommendation: There a "seafood stall" restaurant called La Paradeta near to the Zoo/Park on C/Commercial 7. You can get there on the 14 bus and it's also a stop on the tourist bus. You pick the seafood you want from the "stall", get it weighed, tell them how you want it cooked and they cook it for you. Really fresh and tasty and very reasonably priced. For the amount we ate it would have cost us at least double back in UK. It is down an alley way next to the old market, so mainly locals eat here. They open at 8, we finished our meal at 10:30 and there was still a long queue at that time, so get there early! Best meal we had in Barcelona. We did all the sights and ate too much food so I don't think we'll be going back to Barcelona anytime soon. But when we do go back I would probably choose Icaria again.

Reviews.Title: “Icaria Hotel,Barcelona a great find.”
Reviews.Author: Shaz E
Reviews.Content: Having seen the reviews for this hotel on tripadvisor and the excellent location to the beach and the port, plus the great price we got for two twin rooms with breakfast, myself and three girl friends booked 2 nights here a Sat/Sun at the beginning of Aug. The hotel was very modern and clean with a pool and jacuzzi and a lovely outdoor seating area with big, comfy sofas, ideal for sitting with a drink and book to chill out and de-stress. OK, like other reviews there is building work taking place next door but being a weekend there wasn't any work going on so nice and quiet, i wouldn't let negative reviews put you off using this hotel as the good points far outway the bad. The rooms we had were large with a big modern bathroom and a hot powerful shower and hairdryer, comfy twin beds, air conditioning, fridge/mini bar, flat screen tv and free safe. There is also a free ice machine on every floor. The rate we had included breakfast which provided more than enough variety of food to start the day, cereal, fruit, cakes, even a full english which we all enjoyed and the great coffee, a perfect start to a days sightseeing in Barcelona. Location, great for the beach and the olympic port, five mins walk where there's a sandy beach, a great beach bar and a good selection of restaurants with excellent sea food which are more reasonibly priced than the main centre. The sightseeing bus is a good way to see Barcelona which you can board close to the hotel, a hop on hop off bus so you can see all the sights without having to walk between each one also taxis are easy to find so don't be afraid if the hotel seems to be out of the centre of Barcelona, as we found it was nice to get away from the crowds to our area of Barcelona which we found very safe even late at night. In the short time we had we found this hotel and location to be excellent and would definetly use it again.

Reviews.Title: “Great beach location, hotel lacking”
Reviews.Author: travelchatter
Reviews.Content: The hotel is geared to business travelers, with wireless internet and breakast included. Both made the hotel a huge plus. The buffet breakfast was very nice with fresh fruit, juice, pastries, eggs, ham, toast etc... The hotel was clean and new-ish, I imagine built within the past 5 years. It was built on the cheap. The outlets were falling out of the walls, the furniture looked like it might fall apart soon. The bathroom tile was a fake marble look, which was really cheap. We had numerous problems and were in 2 different rooms. The first room the internet access didn't work on the floor and after 2 days of complaining they moved us to a second room. In this room the shower was broken and they promised to fix and never did. We rigged up our own fix and made it work, but not impressed at all with the staff. They were nice, but didn't go out of their way to help and I didn't see anyone helping with bags! The front desk lost numerous packages of mine, including ones I was sending, ones sent to me, and congress bags. It has a very lovely outside area with tables and couches. Also, a very nice pool and work out area. The location is close enough to the beach and port olympic to walk to, so that was the best thing about it! Before checking in here we stayed at the Hotel Avenida Palace, which was gorgeous and had great staff!! I would go back there, although the hotel Icaria looked like the best hotel to utilize the beach! Also, highly recommend La Fonda restaurant in Port Olympic. They had excellent fresh seafood and paella!

Reviews.Title: “A Barcelona beauty”
Reviews.Author: theluds
Reviews.Content: Just back from a 6 day family break at the Icaria and loved the hotel. We wanted a base in Barcelona that was outside the noise and bustle of the city centre and also offered easy access to the beach. The Icaria's location fitted the bill perfectly, being on the edge of town in the modern Port olmpic area just a few minutes walk from both the beach and marina. Most of the revews posted for the hotel were very positive and the pictures that were available showed good quality accommodation and facilities so we felt we were on to a winner. We weren't disappointed. I would offer the following comments for anyone thinking of going:- a). Location - we loved the fact that if offered the best of both worlds in our opinion, being close to the (great) beaches and also the town centre. There are metro and bus stops close by (bus stop just outside the hotel but metro a bit of a walk) but also numerous taxis passing the hotel. Taxis were good value with prices varying between 5 - 8 euros for the trip into town depending where you want to go. The neighbourhood also seemed very safe and clean and we had no problems walking back late at night from the metro station. Within a few minutes walk there is a small shopping centre and sundry other shops and restaurants. There are also numerous bars and restaurants down on thebeach and around the marina. We felt that the beach bars were fair value but were disappointed with the one meal we had in a restaurant down at the marina. b). Facilities and accommodation - we found all of the staff, but particularly the reception staff, to be very friendly and able to speak very good english. The bedrooms were great, spotlessly clean, a good size and with high quality fittings and fixtures. Must mention the lovely marble bathrooms! There are also free safes in each room which proved useful. TV wise there are nice flat screen tvs but limited english channels, but hey you're on holiday so you shouldn't be watching it anyway! Outside there is a relatively small pool and plenty of seating including comfortable soft seating areas. For those who want it there is also a small fitness suite. c). Food and drink - we thought the breakfast was great with a good choice to suit most peoples needs. Could get a bit busy at times but I suspect that we were generally in there at peak periods. There's a fair range of options for lunch, dinnner, snacks etc too and we felt the quality was very good. Prices seemed pretty fair, particularly when compared to the marina, but one thing I would say is that on both ocassions when we had dinner there we had starters and main courses coming out at different times for different people. This may be a Spanish thing as we also had this problem at restaurants in town, or maybe we're just unlucky! Another slight negative was the price of drinks. Personally we felt these were a bit high for beer and soft drinks. We were paying 4 euros for a glass that held about a third of a pint, which was much more than either the beach bars or other restaurants we went to in town. Yes I know it's a 4 star hotel, but.... d). Other matters - you can't miss it, there are buildings going up around the pool area. We weren't disturbed by the noise particularly as we had rooms on the other side but you have to wonder what impact they will ultimately have on the pool area.
