Obviously not the hotels fault but let's hope they don't build them too high and cut off the sun. So, that's it. Yes there are a few down sides but overall we loved the hotel, it's location and the friendly staff. Bearing in mind the price we paid we feel it fully deserves 5/5. A final quick word about Barcelona itself. It's brilliant. We hope to go back there and finish off the things we never managed to do this time. If we do we shall no doubt return to the Icaria.

Reviews.Title: “Close to Port Olympic”
Reviews.Author: elestoban
Reviews.Content: If you want to be close to Port Olympic,the beach & have a modern hotel with a swimming pool & nice marble bathrooms then this may well be the place for you.The hotel is only 4/500 yards from the beach & port olympic a further few hundred yards. Other than that the location is a bit of track for other districts. The rooms are modern,clean & spacious & the bathrooms excellent. Breakfast which is usually included in the rate is excellent although often a little chaotic. " Please wait to b seated " can mean please wait for us to cross your name of our list - then you are on your own !! Reception tended to be understaffed but friendly & efficient. IIf going to explore Barcelona rather than lie on a beach then I would suggest staying elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “Great apart from the Building Work”
Reviews.Author: Juppsteruk
Reviews.Content: We chose this hotel for a company conference in June 2007. The property was mystery shopped by my events team in March 2007 and we decided that this would be the venue for our 90 guests. I would add there was no building work when the booking was confirmed or any warning that this was going to start. Upon our arrival we were met with the sign of a very large crane and scaffoding directly in eye sight as you entered the swimming pool area. At 7.20am the next morning the building work started and the sound of a metal grinder made sleeping impossible. After very harsh words with the reception manager we were introduced to the hotel manager; an excellent man if ever there was one. He relocated all of our soon to be arrived guests at the front of the hotel, thus away from the noise. He visted the building site and warned the site officer that work wasn't able to start until 8am. He then made our stay as comfortable as he could with free cava in each of the 90 guests rooms, free breakfast the next day and a complementary stay for my events team to come back and sample the hotel, post building work. In summary, we experienced the Icaria probably at its worst. The building work is set to get less obvious and noisy. The conference was saved by the customer service of the manager and his team. When the building work is over (around October 2007 I believe) you will be hard pushed to find a nicer, friendlier hotel, nearer to the beach in Barcelona.

Reviews.Title: “A Hidden Jewel”
Reviews.Author: vershine
Reviews.Content: Our family of 3 travels quite often and are members of several major hotel chains. However, there are no major ones other than Hilton near the waterfront in Barcelona. We opted to try this hotel, Icaria BCN...4 star, 2 blocks from the beach, away from tourists and a 16 multi-plex that plays films in the original language. It is in the Olympic Village area which is very residential but taking #14 bus goes to Port Vell, Las Ramblas and Plaza de Catalunya. and it is only 1.25 euros. The hotel is walking distance to Olympic port with numerous restaurants. If you like to walk, the promenade will all along the waterfront. Now the hotel...It is very modern and chic without feeling pretentious. The regular room was large for European standards, sound proof, comfortable bedding and bed and good quality amenities. The suite includes a computer, so no need to drag a laptop. There are 3 computers gratis for your use in the lobby also. The dining was good. Breakfast was a buffet and dinner had interesting choices that are prepared fresh, so be prepared to wait. But it is worth it. Pricing is very good. We had also ordered room service in which pricing is better than any hotel I have seen in the past. Some items are available 24 hours. The hotel has two outstanding members at the front desk. They are pleasant, knowledgeable and very efficient. I know it is a difficult task when dealing with the public but they do so with ease and a smile, which is important. They make an excellent impression. We decided that this hotel is outstanding in price, comfort and location. We will definitely stay there in the near future.

Reviews.Title: “Pros and cons”
Reviews.Author: Loves-a-quiet-time
Reviews.Content: Pros: Good sized rooms, Great location for Icaria beach and marina with it's numerous eating places but a littel away from the City centre, however tourist bus stop only 50 yards away and the metro 300 yards away, substantial breakfast from 7-11 am. Helpful staff. Swimming pool, Reasonable bar prices for a hotel. I paid £360 for two rooms for 3 nights, breakfast included for two adults. Cons: Building work next to hotel which is ongoing and will eventually cut out light and is a little of an eyesore at present. The new work is nothing to do with the hotel and not their fault. Originally given two rooms on separate floors for myself and my wife and my children. Private function on Saturday evening which substantially put pressure on barstaff. I heard one couple being told a barsnack would take 2 hours. The air conditioning didn't work well in one of the rooms. At checking in, my wife said for safety reasons we needed the rooms to be next to each other and to be fair to the staff this was sorted without any argument. In fact I foung the reception staff very helpful throughout. The building work will have an impact. Work stops at the weekend so I think this would be the best time to go. It is noisy early in the morning in rooms with the pool view. The road side rooms are very quiet but I think a little more expensive. To me the pros outweighed the cons, and I would go back to this hotel. My family had a great time in Barcelona. If I went back with my wife I would book a road-side room and and go at the weekend. I might skip breakfast. It costs £14 euro and there is too much. I am not a big breakfast person.

Reviews.Title: “Thoroughly enjoyed our stay”
Reviews.Author: membernewcastle
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from a 3 night stay and unlike the previous reviewer we thoroughly enjoyed our stay, and hope to return to the hotel next year. There is no disputing that there is building work being carried on just next to the hotel but this did not really have much of an effect on us as we were up early and the workman had finished when we returned. I do agree however that sitting in the pool area will be much better when the work is completed. The hotel itself is very nice, the bedrooms are modern and have a mini fridge, safe and flat screen TV. There is also free Internet access in the room. There are only 2 English channels so your TV viewing is quite limited. We stayed on a bed and breakfast basis and there were a very good variety of foods available. My only slight complaint was that the bacon was just warm, but again this was only a slight niggle and didn't deter us from enjoying the actual breakfast. There is an ice machine on each floor, something we found very useful. The hotel is situated is a fantastic location close to the beach where bars and restaurants are situated. Getting to and from the airport was very easy, on arrival at Barcelona airport we took the airport shuttle bus at a cost of 3.90 Euros each to Placa Catalunya, this leaves right outside the terminal building and runs approx every 12 mins We then bought a T10 ticket at the entrance to the Metro Station, which gave us 5 journeys each, this cost us 7.90 Euros. The station was only 3 stops from the hotel. You could also use the No 41 bus also from Placa Catalunya. To get back to the airport we used the No 41 bus (which stops practically right outside the hotel) which took us to Placa Catalunya where we picked up the airport shuttle bus. During our visit we used the hop on hop off bus, this was 23 Euros for a 2 day ticket, again the bus stop was just around the corner from the hotel, the bus ran from approx 9am to 8pm and was a great means of seeing all the sights Barcelona had to offer. If you are a football fan the Barcelona Nou Camp is well worth a visit. Overall we had a great time in Barcelona and can really recommend this hotel, our main complaint was that we only stayed 3 nights, we could have stayed longer. We will certainly go back.

Reviews.Title: “A good base for exploring Barca !!”
Reviews.Author: BlueFranky
Reviews.Content: Just back from a 4 day stay in Hotel Icaria with my wife and 1 yr old daughter. Booked this hotel through researching online comments such as those on this page and I wasn't disappointed. First lets look at the bigger picture - Barcelona is a very big city which seems to be very geared towards tourism. The 'hub' of the city around the Ramblas is very busy (and much more expensive than elsewhere) and for anyone visiting they are going to explore the city using the tourist bus. Visitors want safe, clean and well located accommodation. Lets look at the positives: 1. Icaria is on the edge of town, placed in the excellent (and seemimgly very safe) Port Olimpic area. Beautiful beaches and hundreds of bars and restaurants are a 5 minute walk from the hotel. 2. There are 2 ATM's literally 200m down the street from the hotel. 3. There is a small shopping mall opposite these machines. 4. The tourist bus stops 200m down the other end of the street (10min ride from Las Ramblas). This means that travel to any tourist destination within the city basically leaves from your doorstep and drops you off there as well. Its away from the bedlam of the city centre yet within reach of it very easily. 5. The hotel is clean, well maintained and staff dealt with any requests in a quick, professional manner. 6. The restaurant food was very nice. 7. Safe in room very secure and used friendly. Now for the negatives: 1.The hotel seemed to have the feel of a 'business type' establishment, but there were other families staying there as well and we did not feel out of place. I have stayed in hotels all over the world and Icaria is as good as any. 2. The staff, while not overly friendly, are good at their job, which is the most important thing. 3. The pool seemed OK (it was too cold to use it) and the gym is basic (x2 treadmills, x2 cycles and a few free weights). 4. The lighting system in the room is wacky - 9 bedside switches and each one does something different each time its pressed 5. Mini-bar products massively overpriced (use the supermarket in shopping mall instead !!) 6. Only x2 English speaking TV channels (CNN World and Nat. Goeg.) 7. Shop around for best price - I rang the hotel directly twice - the first time they quoted me 200E per night then 1 hr later told me they had no availability. I then booked online and got a much better rate than this. So there you have it. In my opinion Icaria is as good an hotel as you will get in Barcelona for the above reasons. This being the first time we had taken our child abroad we were very happy with this Hotel and would recommend it to any friends or family planning a trip there.

Reviews.Title: “Very so so, not worth the price”
Reviews.Author: Noe_erfaren_turist
Reviews.Content: The hotel was OK. Nice room, great bathroom (except the loose paneling in the roof, which made a terrible racket every time the door was opened.) The Good: The room, the bathroom, the breakfast The not so good: Not very central, but buses stopped just outside the door, and taxis came zipping when you extended an arm. No metro, though, and only two bus lines, with approx 20-30 minutes to get to plaza catalunya Very! expensive breakfast . Breakfast were included because of "early booking" but the "breakfast-staff" still tried to get us to sign off for it. When we asked why, they maintained it was not included. Sorted out quickly when we spoke to staff in the reception, but still a bit of an annoyance. The sorting out were probably helped by the fact that we had very good documentation that it were to be included.. Staff attitude and response to legitimate complaints. The bad: Broken A/C (set in "winter position" apparently), which were not fixed the whole stay (5 nights). Instead, it was set on approx 28 degrees, making the room hot!. With no A/C, the window had to be open, and the traffic noise then became an issue. Safe locked when we arrived, and it took way longer to get someone to unlock it than it should have (2 hours and three reminders and finally going down to the reception to get the staff myself) Swimming pool placed so you had to pass through the lobby to and from, no privacy to speak of, and a laughably equipped gym. I never used it even though I would have with a bit more privacy. Never saw anyone else use it either. The ugly: No apologies from the staff for the A/C, no effort to fix it. All in all: Not worth the (quite high) price. For peace and quiet you are better off getting a place in the Rambla, this would also be vastly more central.

Reviews.Title: “Modern and spotlessly clean”
Reviews.Author: Bee40
Reviews.Content: Hi, we booked this hotel thru Alpha Rooms having read some good reviews there, we wern't disappointed. The hotel is modern and staffed by very young people from reception to the catering and even the cleaning...that said, the reception staff are a little aloof...extremely helpful ....but still aloof. We had room 113 which overlooked the pool but was right next to where building work was taking place so was noisy from early am ...however as we wern't gonna be in the room all day we didnt bother changing. The room is spacious, had a fridge, a flat screen tv (only 2 English channels )heating/airconditioning unit which you could adjust yourself, a safe, a couple of comfy seats in addition to the roomy twin beds and a spotlessly clean fully tiled bathroom with a hairdryer in it. The pool/jacuzzi area is gorg with the pool up on a decked area and the terrace had big comfy leather sofas and squashy cushions, (a business meeting took place on the saturday and the pool was off limits )...very hip and trendy but this is overlooked by the building work. The dining room is large and the breakfast was scrumptious, cereal, fruit and yogurt, cheeses and cold meats, bread rolls and bread for toasting,and boiled/scrambled or fried eggs with bacon and baked beans. Also tea/coffee/orange juice and a selection of pastries. Plentiful and hot and just yummy and served from 7 am until 11 am...excellent service. Walk out the front door and turn left, 50 yards down the street cross over the road and then go left across the next road and you are facing the beaches which are just lovely. Before you go to the beach is the touristic bus stop...great value at 24 euro for 2 days and you get on and off them all day long from 9 am until 7 or 8 pm. You could walk into the city in 20 mins briskly but buses and taxis are cheap enough. I would return to this hotel and this area....enjoy.

Reviews.Title: “Highly recommended”
Reviews.Author: Klo2
Reviews.Content: Choosing a hotel for a week in Barcelona was important given that it was going to be my ‘home’ for a 7 days and nights. Various relatives recommended staying near Las Ramblas, as you would be in the heart of the City. However I spent a fair while searching for a hotel in that area but couldn’t secure a hotel for the full 7 nights within the price and star range I wanted (4* around 80-100 euros a night). Then my search stumbled across Hotel Icaria. To be honest it looked too good to be true. The pictures looked fab. and for 5 of the nights I would be paying only 85 euros for what was a 4* hotel which appeared more like a 5* (for the other 2 weekend nights I would be paying a bit more). Some photos are attached. I then looked at Trip Advisor for reviews - overall positive, but with some negative comments about the attitude of reception staff. Also there were notes that it was a bit out of the city, but not too far/costly by taxi. So I went ahead and confirmed. This review was written on my last night. It really has been a fantastic stay and I can highly recommend the hotel. I’m as critical as they come so this recommendation isn’t made lightly! The hotel is very plush with rooms of a high standard. The standard room didn’t offer tea/coffee facilities though, which I discovered after searching every nook and cranny thinking “it must be somewhere!”. I didn’t use the outdoor pool but it appeared very clean and the spa was on whenever I looked. I can imagine it being very nice in slightly warmer weather. I think it’s real plus point is the location. It is so quiet and feels so safe. In fact, were I to live in the central Barcelona I could see myself in this residential area. The hotel is a bit out of town but not isolated with cafes and restaurants within 5-10 minutes walk. There is also a large supermarket within a few minutes (look for El Centre de la Ville). More so has been the ease of travel into the centre. The 41 bus stop is less than a minute away and takes you to Playa Cataluyna (and on route via other areas of interest). Taking the 41 bus the other way leads you to a new mall. The other main bus I used is the 36, which goes along the beach/harbour area and again the bus stop must be less that 2 minutes away. The bus is 1.25 euros but is cheaper with the travel cards. The hotel has the public transport maps available to take away and I would recommend studying them as I was pleasantly surprised by the ease of access to tourism areas. In addition, the Bus Touristoc stops less than a minute away. I did get a taxi from the bus station and it was about 8 euros. One back from La Sagrada Familia was 6 euros. Also for anyone searching the forum for the term disability/disabled I was really impressed by the bus’ disabled access. It all seemed so routine and quick, with people in wheelchairs getting on and off via an electronic disabled access ramp and having a space on the bus, with such ease. Also concerning location I walked past the Las Ramblas hotels I had looked at and now can only imagine them to be cramped, noisy and without the peacefulness of this area. Saying that on the third morning I was woken by the sound of drilling. On booking I had asked for a quiet room and was appropriately given one overlooking the pool, but it turned out that a building was being constructed next door. I phoned the reception and asked for a quieter room and within 5 mins a receptionist was at my door with a key for a room on the 6th floor, albeit on the main road but an upgrade and much quieter (and with tea/coffee facilities!). On that note, the reception staff have been very helpful and knowledgeable when approached. The technological side of the hotel has been good, but not quite as exuberant as implied by advertising. In both rooms the LCD TV had excellent quality, however they only have two and sometimes three English channels (CNBC and National Geographic and sometimes CNN), but that seems above average for the area. Neither room came with a DVD but I didn’t specifically ask for one (with the hotel info. stating that extras could be supplied when requested). As noted in other reviews of the hotel, the lighting system, was in principal, a bonus, but with no instructions I would find myself pressing a button on the panel by the bed, then finding that the light I wanted to turn off was still on. I would then get up and try the light switch itself, though sometimes that seemed to be overridden! Even working out how to get lights on in the first place was a bit like the Krypton Factor, until I realised you need to put your card key in a slot by the door. Very clever idea once you work it out! A real plus was the free internet access. From both of the rooms I was in I was connected within seconds. Overall, I would certainly stay here again, though do wonder about prices in high season given the beach location. If you find a deal here though that looks too good to be true I would go for it. Oh yes - Barcelona itself is a must see city! It was a great week.

Reviews.Title: “one of the very best!!!”
Reviews.Author: red kop
Reviews.Content: Have just returned from barcelona,and after reading most of the reviews on tripadvisor i knew i was booking in to a great hotel!!!well people you were not wrong,from the moment we arrived nothing was too much trouble to the staff on reception,bedroom with plasma screen + marbled bathroom fantastic,outside by the pool + jacuzzi,a class area to chill,check it out!!the hotel is only 5 mins walk from the olympic marina,but did'nt hear a thing at nite!!!plenty of bars + restaurants in the marina area,would reccomend one called the barnabier,great food + drink...Also walked along the promenade to the chair lift which gives you great views over the city..be very careful when you visit the ramblas area,as pickpocketing is a very real problem!!!enjoy Barca + the Icaria you won't be dissapointed!!!Oh and by the way i was there to watch my team Liverpool f.c. win in the nou camp once again!!!!priceless!!

Reviews.Title: “Nice,Clean and modern hotel”
Reviews.Author: lenny1976
Reviews.Content: Took a chance on this hotel based on previous reviews and i wasn't dissappointed. Its a nice, modern hotel that is super clean and with rooms that are quite comfortable and modern. The location is spot on with the Beach and the port olympic marina just a 2-3 minute walk from the hotel. The nearest metro stop is 5-10 mins away which is great for heading into the more vibrant Ramblas area. The olympic area is ideal for dining as there are numerous Restuarants there as well as many bars for the after dinner drink!!!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel”
Reviews.Author: Weekend
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 3 nights with 4 teenagers. Chose it as it had pool, gym and internet, all of which kept them happy when we had half an hour to spare! Most of the time however, was spent sightseeing and although the hotel was slightly out of the centre, it was only a ten minute busride away and not too long a walk - with the weather at 23 degrees most days, that was fine. The tour bus stopped close to the hotel too. It was walking distance to the restaurants and nightlife at the port which made a great night out . We found the hotel relaxing, and while the staff kept a low profile, they were there when you needed them. The full breakfast was excellent, high quality and with lots of choice, superb for ever hungry male teenagers. Overall, very good value and highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “A treat for the eye”
Reviews.Author: kaybxl
Reviews.Content: I simply loved my stay at Icaria. The hotel is situated near the beach, but it didn't bother me having to take the underground/bus to get to the vibrant city centre. I like my hotels peaceful and quiet. The hotel also has a swimming pool. Excellent way to spend your little siesta. The rooms are very clean. Wooden floors, modern design, beautiful bathroom... On the downside: the airco in our room had its quirks and the bed was way to hard...

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: irelandtraveller26
Reviews.Content: Stayed in the Icaria Hotel, Barcelona in September 2006. I was a bit apprehensive going, after reading a few bad reviews on Tripadvisor website but I can safely say I found the hotel to be very clean and staff on reception were very helpful and friendly. Rooms are very modern, with plasma and mini fridge in our room, and the pool area is nice. Nice gym too. Hotel is only apx 20 min drive (€30 in a taxi) from Barcelona airport and it's only a two minute walk to the beach and Port Olympic. Taxi to the city centre only costs between €5 and €9 and taxi to the Nou Camp is around €10. I was glad I didn't stay in the main La Ramblas area as Port Olympic is much nicer. Plenty of Irish Bar's around La Ramblas area and there's also one in the Port Olympic. Plenty of nice restaurants there too. I would defintely stay in the Icaria Hotel again and would recommend it to friends.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Hotel, shame about the breakfast service..”
Reviews.Author: Annora
Reviews.Content: We stayed in this hotel at the end of August and it was absolutely brilliant aside from the breakfast wait staff ignoring us. Look at the pictures on the website above and they are exactly like that. We had a suite and it came with its own computer which was a major bonus - saved us from waiting to use the ones in the lobby. It also had a cd player and we had two rooms which was really nice. The bathroom is HUGE as well and there are a lot of accessories that you get too, so another bonus. I loved the pool area and the jacuzzi. Didnt get to use too much of it but we sat by the pool a couple of nights and drank Sangria so I was happy - the guys in the bar were just LOVELY and very helpful - even grabbing me a light snack that wasnt really on the menu and bringing it to me poolside! ANGELS! REALLY LIKE the fact that the tourist bus stop is just around the corner so you can get back to the hotel after a day cruising on the various busses looking at sites. The location is nearish to the Olympic port area (walking distance of about 5mins) which is nice - just dont stop at the first restaurant you see or like us you will have a dodgy meal. There are not very many options for vegetarians in Barcelona so make sure you get a few tips and maps on where to eat if you want to get fed properly and whatever you do - DONT EAT ON LAS RAMBLAS!! eeek.. the food was sooooo soooo bad!!! scary - wish we'd been warned before so now you have. The nightlife is awesome so have a blast and enjoy Barcelona folks, we did!

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel, Wonderful City, Fabulous Holiday!”
Reviews.Author: loves_traveling15
Reviews.Content: Upon arrival of the hotel it looked fabulous, very clean and well looked after despite the scruffy surroundings outside. Our rooms were spotless and ready on time when we arrived there at 2:30 pm! However the rooms could of been a little bigger but the bathroom made up for it. The restaurant and bar were lovely however the menu wasnt the most exciting and didnt have alot of choice and also did not have a childrens menu or food suitable for small children, luckily the breakfast buffet did, you could eat as much as you want but food did run out fast! The pool complex is very small! This was a let down as it appeared a decent size in the pictures, the gym is good quality but again very small. I did enjoy the sauna and steama room but they did not work for 2 days during our stay. The location of the hotel is perfect!!! just 5 minutes walk from the gorgeous beach and, thanks to the bus stop just around the corner, just 5 minutes drive from the city centre where there is lots to do and see. There is also a mini-mall just down the road where you will find a large choice of restaurants, clothes shops and a large supermarket. Overall, I had a very enjoyable holiday and would highly recommend this hotel to couples and families with teenagers.

Reviews.Title: “Barcelona is the best city”
Reviews.Author: Missing_barca
Reviews.Content: It was my first trip to barcelona. Nice, busy city. The hotel is located very well because it's quiet at night. Not to far from the metro and a bus stop just before the hotel, close to the beach. For the hotel : very good airconditioning, nice pool and comfy seats outside, modern rooms, clean bathrooms. The breakfast was good, a lot to choose from, only there wasn't enough staff. You've to waited a long time till you got what you ordered. I was there from 7 august and I enjoyed my stay. Anyone who was there also during this time, feel free to contact me at guccilise@hotmail.com.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, Great Location, OK Staff”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stayed there for 7 nights. The hotel itself was lovely, good sized rooms and bathrooms with great decor, the airconditioning DID work for us, rooms cleaned daily and the pool was fab. Didn't eat at the hotel at all so couldn't comment on the food although need to say the room service menu didn't look very expensive. The location of the hotel is excellent, 2 minutes from Boegetal beach and about 30 minute walk to la rambla. There is also the number 41 bus right outside the hotel which takes you to placa de catalonyia. The staff were ok, quick check-in but not exactly the most approachable bunch but at the same time did nothing really to offend. Like others said, there is a bakers just around the corner and the other way a large shopping centre which has various restaurants and a big supermarket on the basement floor. There are also plenty of banks close by and taxis frequently pass so there is no trouble in flagging one down. Overall I would definitely recommend this place, its near enough to the centre of town for easy access but also far enough out that you can appreciate the beauty of the fantastic beaches.

Reviews.Title: “SNOOTY SNOOTY SNOOTY”
Reviews.Author: ginosesto
Reviews.Content: We had an amazing rate that the hotel nearly refused to honor. It was a Friday night and they did not like that I was paying so cheap. Staff was incredibly snooty and rude. Room was GREAT. Internet access is free with a 10 dollar deposit for the cable. Breakfast was okay, nothing to write home about. Staff all over had an attitude. Felt completely unwelcomed from check-in to check-out. Overall it's okay if you don't mind rude people.
